review_content:
Golden yellow when poured, thin white head.
Aroma - Malt,  Sweet corn.
Taste - Not so much taste to this beer, Malt, Corn.
Easy drinking summer beer.
12 oz can pours a golden color with a small white head.  Aromas of sweet malt, not much else.  Light bodied, not much going on here.

Pours the same slight yellow color of Corona 
Extra with a thin white head that does not lace. Nose is faint malt. Taste is weak malt and corn. The bitter aftertaste overwhelms this beer. There is nothing redeeming in this beer aside from its color. 12 oz can BBY 6/21

2/9/21: After drinking through a 12 pack and comparing it to Corona Extra, I am changing my assessment. The only comment  changed is the bitterness is dominant in the aftertaste but does not overwhelm meaning I misjudged the beer. And a side note, the tendency is to drink beer too cold inhibiting its aroma and taste.
Una cerveza muy leve tanto en aroma con en sabor, recomendada para refrescar en un día soleado.
Clear golden color. Faint aroma of malt. Not much is going on in the taste. Well, this is the way it was intended to be.
Bottle.  Golden color. Not much aroma and taste. It needs a line to give it any flavor.  For a summer beer it’a not too bad.

12oz bottle out of a 6 pack bought by a Hispanic construction worker at convenience store beside jobsite and given to me for helping him unload materials with loader. Drank straight from bottle. Aroma: light citrus scent with floral and hoppy green quality. Appearance: it's color is purely transparent with a nearly pretty golden shine. Taste: a very weak lager with notes of hops and doughy overtones. Not very flavorful at all. Mouthfeel: it is a lightly carbonated brew that is very thin and watery. Leaves your mouth feeling as if you've sucked on your pocket change. Overall: I didn't particularly favor the experience but the beer did have somewhat of a fresh quality that made it drinkable.
0,33 litre Bottle from Old Cellar Collection. Golden with little head. Malts, hops, sweetness, tastes a bit like alcohol Free Beer.
Bottle left at my house by someone. Poured a pale yellow colour, no head, limited carbonation. Smell was straw, vegetal. Pretty tasteless, thin lager. Only upshot was it was cold
12 ounce bottle at Beef O’Bradys in Stow Ohio. Smell the grain. Light yellow in the clear bottle. Taste the grain. Light and smooth. Lawnmower beer to me. Cheers!
Nice, light, and refreshing with a bit of a weird tang to it. A little less flavorful than the original

(355 ml bottle at K-Bob's Steakhouse, Raton, New Mexico; 1 April 2018) 4:2:4:2:6=1.8
Anna says: 'Not much taste. Lots of fizz.' - my sister.  'If I'm going to drink a Light, I'd prefer a Coors Light.  Or Busch Light.  Or something.' - my Dad.  'Like the American beer I used to have.  It was fizzy, but the fizz made it more interesting.' - my mother.  A boring light lager that is quite pale and stands out most for its fizziness.  Negligible aroma.  There are no nasty tastes here unless carbonic acid counts, and no identifiable hops or grains were harmed in the making of this product. Unusually, Phil didn't have this.
This beer taste like piss and shit, the only reason I gave it a 1.1 is because the Nelk boys send Coronas.

This tastes like tap water filtered through my grandmothers pantyhose. Lord it is not the best beer ever. No wonder people loaded up with lemons and limes.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

355 ml clear bottle. Clear, straw colour, thick white head, medium low carbonation. Aroma of white bread and corn. Mouthfeel is thin, low carbonation. Tastes as the aroma. All in all you get what you expect, an adjunct light lager, brewed with corn syrup. Nothing wrong with it, it's just dull.
Golden yellow when poured, thin white head. Aroma - Malt, Sweet corn. Taste - Not so much taste to this beer, Malt,…
12 oz can pours a golden color with a small white head.  Aromas of sweet malt, not much else.  Light bodied, not much going on here.

Pours the same slight yellow color of Corona Extra with a thin white head that does not lace. Nose is faint malt. Taste is weak malt and corn. The bitter aftertaste overwhelms this beer. There is nothing redeeming in…

Clear golden color. Faint aroma of malt. Not much is going on in the taste. Well, this is the way it was intended to be.
Bottle.  Golden color. Not much aroma and taste. It needs a line to give it any flavor.  For a summer beer it’a not too bad.

Bottle left at my house by someone. Poured a pale yellow colour, no head, limited carbonation. Smell was straw, vegetal. Pretty tasteless, thin lager. Only upshot was it was cold
12 ounce bottle at Beef O’Bradys in Stow Ohio. Smell the grain. Light yellow in the clear bottle. Taste the grain. Light and smooth. Lawnmower beer to me. Cheers!
Nice, light, and refreshing with a bit of a weird tang to it. A little less flavorful than the original

(355 ml bottle at K-Bob's Steakhouse, Raton, New Mexico; 1 April 2018) 4:2:4:2:6=1.8 Anna says: 'Not much taste. Lots of fizz.' - my sister. 'If I'm going to drink a Light, I'd prefer a Coors Light. Or Busch Light. Or something.' - my Dad. 'Like the American…
This beer taste like piss and shit, the only reason I gave it a 1.1 is because the Nelk boys send Coronas.
This tastes like tap water filtered through my grandmothers pantyhose. Lord it is not the best beer ever. No wonder people loaded up with lemons and limes.…

355 ml clear bottle. Clear, straw colour, thick white head, medium low carbonation. Aroma of white bread and corn. Mouthfeel is thin, low carbonation. Tastes as the aroma. All in all you get what you expect, an adjunct light lager, brewed with corn…

4-4-3-1-7
Bottle, 3,9 ABV, 11 months before bbd. Finally I get to this timeless classic. All the way from a continent far, far away comes this watered down version of the otherwise brilliant, near perfection of tastelessness. Pours a beautiful crystal clear, pale yellow, with a creamy head. Some sharp, citrusy hoppiness in the aroma, with a flat, dull biscuity sense of malts, with notes of dry, Mexican hay. Light to medium body, with average carbonation. Flavour has a sharp, citrusy hoppy edge, and light biscuity malts with floral notes of honey, minerals and hay. It's almost kind of fresh and rather crisp, with a nice dryness. Yet, still there's a sweet finish of cardboard, garden compost as well as light metal and garbage that's no winner in my little book of beer preferences.
Blah. If you're going to drink a beer that has barely any substance there are better options than this. Looks like pee. Flavor was muted but it's what people want I guess.
Bottle, mexican piss golden color without much lasting head. Notes are piss, cereal, cracker, and the lime that the asshole barkeep put into it. Thin and trashy

Can on some beach in Puerto Escondido, Mexico. Clear light golden liquid with small white head. Aroma of corn, light bread and... nothing? Taste is very light sweet and very light bitter with notes of bread and light corn. Light bodied with medium to high carbonation. Unoffensive but very bland.
Can from Arizona - clear pale golden, white head. actually better than I thought. not overly sweet. not much else going on here, of course. watery.
Sapore ottimo, colore ottimo, prezzo ottimo, accessibilità ottima, ottimo tutto, perfetta soprattutto se vi piace il cazzo come me.

Bottle at friends house. Clear light straw color with foamy head. Aroma of light malt and adjuncts. Taste of light malt sweetness corn and other adjuncts. Light bitterness and dry finish. Light body and lacking and quite bland. Needs lime.

white head with poor retention, that reduces to a thin spotty lace cap that lingers. Slight spotty lacing clings on the glass, with a light amount of streaming carbonation. Good appearance. Aromas of cracker, corn, white bread, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Nice and pleasant aromas with pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop notes; with solid strength. Taste of cracker, corn, white bread, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness. Light-moderate herbal, floral, grassy, peppery bitterness on the finish. Lingering notes of cracker, corn, white bread, lightly toasted biscuit, pepper, and herbal/floral/grassy earthiness on the finish for a good bit. A bit of skunky aromas/flavors, but not overwhelming at all. Nice robustness and balance of pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; with a great malt/bitterness balance, and no astringent flavors after the finish. Moderately crisp/clean finishing. Perfectly clean on lager flavors, with no fruity/yeasty notes present. Moderate increasing dryness from lingering bitterness. Medium carbonation and light body; with a very smooth and fairly bready/grainy/sticky balanced mouthfeel that is good. A bit thin but not watery. Zero warming alcohol as expected of 4.1%. Overall this is a good light adjunct lager. All around good robustness and balance of pale malt/grains and light-moderate earthy hop flavors; very smooth, crisp, clean, and refreshing to drink. Surprisingly flavorful for the ABV. Very clean pils malt/grains, and nice earthy hop presence/balance for the style. Not overdone on adjuncts. A nicely enjoyable offering, and impressive style example. Thought this was better than the Extra overall.
Bottle at Courtyard by Marriot Los Angeles/LAX. Golden with a white head. Swwet and thin with corn, bread and some grass. The body was light as was the bitterness. A boring one.

Color amarillo pálido. Un dedo de espuma con retención baja. Aroma desagradable metálico. Gusto horrible metálico, no puedo sacar más matices porque no pasé de los dos tragos. Cuerpo acuoso. Un desastre difícil de igualar.

Bought accidently and I hope it will never happen again. I'm not into light beers, but this is one of the worst I've ever tried. Its like a light version of light version, for sure too watery. To jakieś nieporozumienie
Bright notes of corn in the aroma. Clear yellow color with a large white airy head. Devoid of most taste but lightly sour in the beginning. Extremely light palate.
This is some kind of water trying to be sold as beer. Maybe if you never have tasted beer this would be nice.

Perhaps the poorest light beer I have ever tasted. Nothing much of a head to speak of, a lifeless body, very minor aroma, and a flavor that follows suit. I have tasted some half-decent light beers, but I will not be drinking this one ever again, not even for free.
Lyst strågult, ikke skum, korn, papp, sitron, TYNN...................................

26/6/2018. Bottle at the Renaissance hotel, Las Vegas. Pours golden with a white head. Aroma of sweet malt, corn, fruit and grass. Medium to heavy sweetness, light bitterness. Light body, sticky but watery texture, average carbonation.

Nærmest ingen smak. Hvordan går det? 
Uansett så ble resten helt ned i vasken
2,6/10
180619
Hey. It’s good for what it is. Light watered down Mexican style of lager that’s nice and refreshing on a hot Memorial Day weekend.
It sits somewhere between beer and sherbet. On ratebeer I give it a 2. On ratesherbet I give it a 3.
Can at Secrets Silversands in Riverera Maya. Hey., Just trying to nail down all the bad resort beers I can. Wierd metallic nose. Fairly close to water. At least the lime helps.

Bottle. Grainy malt aroma and not much else. Pours clear golden colored with a thin white head that has little retention and no lacing. Starts with some grainy malt. Finishes. Good on a hot day maybe, but it’d have to be really hot.
Corona Light tem aproximadamente 30% menos calorias do que Corona Extra com o mesmo sabor refrescante, e também é fabricada com ingredientes da mais alta qualidade.

More or less complete piss but not offensive per se and at least it goes down

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
just get the regular corona. these still need the lime though. but hell yeah limes are great
12 ounce bottle at a Mexican restaurant. Pale gold with a decent white head. Mild aroma of grain and grass. Taste is the same. Ok under the circumstances.
Watery with a really poor body and no distinctive flavor to speak of. I can honestly say that this is the only beer I have made the choice not to finish.
Taste like watered down Corona.  Gets skunky very easily. Not a very good beer. Lime is a must.

It's just about as basic of a beer can get, but add a lime and drink it In the summer heat and it might just surprise you.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

75 caracters long 75 caracters long 75 caracters long 75 caracters long 75 caracters long 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Corona Light is fucking awesome nothin better w a lime. You are lying if you don't like one on a hot summer day.

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
Straw color with a thin white head. Aromas of cereal and perhaps bread. Flavors are corn, cereal, bready notes and mild hops. Watery mouthfeel. Very light and easily drinkable.
Found cans by elevator at trade winds. Nose is bad and cereal, smooth and watery when cold. Weak and cheap tasting but good in hot heat and when the beer is freezing.
12 oz bottle from the half-case. A bit weak and diluted but not too bad. A lime will help to boost the flavor a bit.

Not awful! Pours pale gold w/ a thin white head & no lacing. The aroma is skunky & grainy. The taste is mainly grain but goes down relatively easy. There’s certainly nothing great or even good going on here but overall it’s passable I suppose.

From the 12 fl. oz clear bottle. No lime. The pour is yellow with a quick lasting white fizzy head. Excellent clarity. The aroma reminds me of white bread, grains, and rice with a light grassy hop note. Thin watery body. The taste is clean and crisp with a breadiness to it. You could quaff these down like water
The diet erosion of Coroan that works on a level just above water with a children’s dose of alcohol tolerance. Good counterpart for coronaritas if I have anything positive to say.

USED to drink this all the time...last 2 cases have been "SKUNK BEER"...just like when I used to drink Molson Golden. I don’t know what causes it...but whew! 

Going to have to try something else...
Not bad for what it is. I’d say go with Corona Extra if you are going for a beach beer this is little too watery.

Bottle at the boathouse last night. 
Pale yellow small head. This kind of grainy and watery but real easy to toss back especially with the lime properly inserted. Better than the stale Boston Lager they had.

This is middle of the summer, hot as hell, chilled off beer to guzzle with a lime to add. Never poured this beer. Never will. Wah, wah. You drink it because it tastes good. In the middle of the summer. When the beer is ice cold. All right yellow in the bottle, again because you will not pour it. Slam it, one, two, three. With the lime it is all right. Straw, a slight citrus taste. But that is not the point. Tell me wrong.
Yeah, this is p...water. Nothing going on. Oh yeah, carbonation. Avoid at at costs.
[backlog] 26-03-16 // can at Playa Palancar, Isla mujeres, Mexico. Tastes like water with hints of grains.

12 oz. bottle. Pours a medium, poorly retained white head, over a straw, (SRM 2) effervescent body......nose is mild malts, with hints of hops, mild skunk........taste is hints of malts, minimal hops, with mild bitterness, moderate skunkiness.....mouth feel, light and watery body, no alcohol, high carbonation. This is a terribly light rendition of a very light and uninteresting general style. Think of it as colored and flavored water except for the mild skunkiness. BJCP 3/3/7/3/4
Bottle to frosted mug. It poured clear straw gold with a small white head. Minimal carbonation. No aroma, too cold. Flavor is sweet with some skunkiness. Adding the lime did add some citrus to it.

Pours a very light, very clear color. The condensation on the outside of the glass makes a shimmer that is beautiful, but hey....aggressive pour and barely any head. No lacing.

Aroma is not skunked. Has the typical Mexican beer aroma, only lighter. Mostly corn. Like opening a can of corn. Corn and maybe some crackers. I also keep thinking I catch a whiff of coffee.

Taste is very light and watery. Mostly watery. I taste the corn. I can’t detect any hops really. It’s really not bitter at all. It has flavor, but not a lot.

. Mouthfeel is super light and watery. It’s super refreshing. That’s really the whole point of the beer.

Overall, it’s pretty good. Now, it’s one I’m going to rush out and buy again. I like rating beers, but sometimes, I get a little bored with it. This is a good beer to just sit and drink and chillax. For this one, I’m neutral whether or not I’d buy it again, or recommend it.

Bottle to pint. Looks decent; a completely transparent lighter gold with white head that steadily dissipates into lacing. Smells and tastes mildly hoppy and skunky with notes of lager yeast. Mouthfeel is light-bodied. An inoffensive, underwhelming light macro lager.
Absolutely nothing to this beer. Could be alcoholic spring water. No calories and little else!
Pours pale yellow with aroma of grain and metal. Slight grain flavor. Not much else happening.

BBQ beer. I haven’t had one of these in years, and I was struck by how little flavor it had at all. It really isn’t any of the usual Macro flavors. It isn’t skunky or corn-heavy or sulfurous. It just tastes like 98% water mixed with 2% light lager.
It's pretty much watered down Corona which ain't much substance to begin with. Watery corny. Yup.

Clear 12oz bottle into a Corsendonk tulip in California on 18th May 2016. Pale golden with a white head, clean, clear and bright body, no staying power in the head. Corn and lime aroma/taste: refreshing and an ideal ’sitting in the sun doing nothing’ sort of beer. Of all the Corona’s (I am no expert) I have had, this one I enjoyed the most.

I’ve saved this bottle for some reason. I ended up with it when a six pack that was brought over by friends was consumed 5/6 of the way. Not knowing what to do with it, I decided that an occasion would pop up. Cinco de Mayo, paired with needing to drink beer at home that has no shelf life, leads to a memorable rating. Didn’t bother pouring this. Just didn’t seem right. Shiny golden color. Skunk definite aroma. Flavor is near absent. Carbonated water that was poured into a vessel that contained about an ounce of lager left. Lager infused sparkling water. Coming to a fancy hotel lobby near you. I can enjoy a Corona on a hot day, but Corona light is a bit annoying to me. I’m sure I’ll find myself drinking this again someday when I’m traveling and my options are as limited as the flavor is with this beer.
C. Pours a crystal clear straw color with white head. Not much flavor, but easy drinking and not too bad with a lime
Everything I expected it to be and worse - really watery with a feint hint of corn.

12oz bottle at a Cuban restaurant in Tampa 

Clear light golden, no head or lacing. Mild aroma is skunky and grains. Taste is grainy, cereal and doughy 
 
Ok, not offensive

Bottle on Celebrity Millennium. Grainy neutral, not much aroma, fresh and grainy with no bitterness. 
Refreshing and neutral-smooth.

Straight from the bottle to wine glass with lime very cold beer 
Appearance: Light pale yellow, minimal head, a lot of lacing 
Aroma: scent smell of malt, nothing else 
Taste: not really great Mouth feel: very carbonated 
Overall: good beer for the hot weather in the Philippines, and not to get drunk since it is soda the most inexpensive way

On tap at The Embassy Suites (O’Hare) during the complimentary evening reception. Clear, light yellow appearance with a lacy white head. Very bland and plain. Hints of corny malt sweetness and husky grains. Yikes.

I enjoy a Corona every once in a while and this is just a slightly lighter version. Typical cereal & light skunk aroma and flavor with a watery body. Not a choice for me but not horrible, and not bad for a light beer.
Bottle. Pours clear/yellow. Aroma was sweet and grains. Taste was watered down.
"Not much flavor, skunky aroma, watered down, substandard beer. dont waste your time here. Hate to say it but regular corona is better.

12 oz bottle. From a grocery store in Honolulu, HI.

Clear golden color with a small white head. 
Familiar skunky Corona aroma with sweetness, malt, corn and some hops. 
The flavor is sweet malt, corn and mild hops. 
Not much of a beer... but better than the three American light beers.

A clear golden beer with a small dissipating white head
A, something reminiscent of puke in the far back. 
Lightly malty and fruity. No puke in the flavor, . Thin on the palate. Short finish. A rather sorry excuse for a beer

I have no idea why, but I enjoyed this more than the Corona Extra that I had subsequently. Surprisingly for Corona, neither of them was redolent of skunkiness. The only other time I’ve had a Corona Light in my life was when, after my junior year in college, I hung around town and got a job on campus cleaning vacated dorms. In one refrigerator that someone had left was one Corona Light. I popped it open while I was cleaning and thought that even though it was Maryland in the summer and a nice cold lager might be refreshing, this one was horrible. So maybe tonight’s was better in my mind because of that experience. Whatever.
Strågul farge, helt gjennomsiktig. Lavt skum. Anonym aroma av malt. Søt smak. Korn. Forfriskende, men absolutt ikke mer!

Pretty much no smell...looks cold crisp and refreshing though...and clear...taste starts a bit bitter and mellows but not in a bad way...has that unique corona taste that is almost a pilsner but maltier and better...very touch sweet in finish...only rates low due to no smell and appearance
One of the worst beers ever! My character on my show wouldn’t even try it because it’s so bad >>>>>>>> https://www.youtube.com/watch?v=d54EiIPdjeI <<<<<<< Watch to find out what I thought!

I poured it from the can into a glass with lime.  It pours golden with a quickly dissipating, fizzy, white head.  The aroma is corn malt and lime. The taste is the same with the added lime. It is crisp, carbonated and pretty refreshing. It does not have the metallic aftertaste Corona Extra sometimes has. Without the lime, there is really nothing to it. With the lime, it is inoffensive and refreshing.

bottle @ Party Town / Florence KY --- Aroma of malt and an adjunct. Clear light amber color, no head, no lace. Taste is light malt that is overwhelmed by a lot of carbonation. Carbonation provides the edge to keep balance. This is for sure a beer to drink on hot days when taste doesn’t matter.
Bottle. Pours a yellow color with rapidly disappearing white head. Aroma is a bit skunky with grain notes. Very light bodied with very little flavor. Thin and unexciting. Avoid.

12 oz. bottle courtesy of the in-laws; consumed from the bottle at the annual family reunion. Aroma: Lemony notes stick out the most, but there’s some kind of semi sweet adjunct quality as well (I hesitate to call it corn). Appearance: Pale yellow color with average carbonation holding up white foam that stays afloat throughout. Flavor: Lemon stays behind semi sweet adjunct notes for the most part; there’s actually a whiff of hop perfume at the finish, which dries out well enough. Palate: Medium body, sticky texture, average carbonation, abrupt finish. Overall: It’s a fairly clean, if not totally pleasing, light lager experience. This is rated pretty low here, but honestly, there are worse beers brewed in Kentucky.
It’s a corona lt. Light beer. Light taste. Very poundable. Nothing crafty. I just want another beer on my profile.

ITS COOL THAT CORONA’S MAKE LITE BEER FOR THE POOL OR HOT DAY AT THE SHOOTING RANGE. THE SECRET LET ME TELL YOU THAT PUT IT ICE COLD THEN HAVE SALT AND LIME IN IT. YOU WILL NEVER NOW IT TASTE EXSCALTY LIKE REGLAR CORONA’S. SO THAT IS A GOOD TIP TOO KEEP SLIM AND COOL FOR THOSE FCS HANGING AROUND THE POOL (CAN YOU FEEL ME NOW!!!!)
Flaske delt med Ovesen (heldigvis, hadde ikke greid den alene): klar lys strågul med kort hvitt skum. Aroma av mais og sukkertøy. Søtlig smak, tynn, minner egentlig om brus. Huff&huff.

Bottle shared with JMD at HNB 02.07.15. Clear and very pale straw colour. Weak aroma of maize and wine gum. Similar and waterish taste. Weak, but unattractive, bitterness of artificial sweeteners. Like making love in a canoo, only less pleasuring.

Drank from the bottle at Chuys in Rogers. Meh. Lawnmower. Drinkable. Just hopefully not too much. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

330 ml clear bottle. (3.9% ABV) Pours a clear pale yellow with a thin, fizzy white head. Skunky aroma with some corn. Mildly sweet flavour of corn and grass. Light body with a watery texture and fizzy carbonation. Thirst quenching in the heat but really needs a lime to add flavour. Pretty boring.
Pale, thin, a little tinny. Straight from the skinny can in Old Mexico. Not good.
Bottom of the barrel....complete junk beer....if u add lime it is drinkable....yuck.....(#517)
Very clear with white head. Citrus snd some sweet malt. Clean, crisp and watery finish. Overall: close to water. No brewing faults. Session deluxe.

The absolute most nothing beer around. No color to speak of urine yellow and urine after a ton of beer. Smell of nothing, no grain no malt no hops no nothing. Just something you dump upside down n a crappy margarita.
12 oz bottle. Pours a pale yellow color. Aroma is slightly yeasty, and it’s the best part of this beer. Overall it’s fine.

Can’t tell the difference between this and the regular Corona. Doesn’t taste any lighter and seems to be same ABV. With other light beers you can tell a bit of a difference at least. So my rating of this is the same.
Maybe if it came in the dark bottle as a Corona Familiar Light I would rate it slightly higher...just for the brown bottle!
There is a reason you should squeeze a lime into this beer otherwise it would be unpalatable.
From bottle, but probably no foam there. Quite fresh, lime inserted which is mostly determining the taste. (Huntsville 201505)
Nothing like a new Mexican lager tick at work to kick of el cinco de Mayo. It’s everything I imagined it would be and not an ounce more. Bottle with lime.

Bottle - pale yellow color, pretty dull malty, corny aroma and flavor, just a watered down version of regular Corona really, nothing special, stick with the regular version of you really want a Corona 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Poured from a 12 OZ bottle into a pint glass at Sam Snead’s in Pooler, GA. I have had this beer before, usually drunk and after sitting for hours in the sun. This time i was sober and in air conditioning. The result was horrendous. This beer has no real beer flavor and the taste that is does have makes me want to regurge. It looks like unflushed toilet water and the aroma is notn-existent unless you have been fortunate enough to toss in a lime.
There is nothing redeeming about this beer. The absolute worst.
Muy suave, prácticamente es tomar agua. Es una cerveza para veranear y aplacar la sed.
Fonefan 251014. Golden-yellow colour with a white head. Aroma is fruit, malt, corn. Flavour is fruit, malt, corn, hay. Bad beer.

I also agree that I prefer this light version over the regular Corona Extra. Maybe just because the taste isn’t as strong so tastes more like a pilsner to me. A little lighter in color too. A good daytime beer, at the beach, or on some tropical island where this is the best it gets.

Ugh, drinking this was penitential, I tried it out of morbid curiosity... Mexican corn water with a hint of pungent grain and skunk. More fizz than flavor. This bottle was lightstruck as most clear-bottled Coronas are. Thinner and paler than the standard Corona, which is rather pale and thin in its own right, it's not like standard Corona is a heavy beer anyway so I fail to see the need for a lighter variation. Absolutely no redeeming quality to this beer, it's not even cheap! You're better off going with Budlight or Ultra, now that's saying something!

Boa cerveja. 
Possui corpo leve e refrescante. Combina com uma comida mais apimentada...
Bottle at Senor Frog in Cancun. Surprised this place isn’t on Ratebeer. Crystal clear very pale yellow color. Aroma of light straw. Taste is papery lemon and straw, light body. Needs a lime.
Bottle. Tastes how it looks- kinda like watery urine. Basically smells the same. Needs lime which tells you a lot

Bottled@AIH40 (from Rema 1000, Kirkenes). Yellowish golden colour small white head. Aroma is rice, some bread and strange cardboardy notes. Flavour is rather similar. Watery and not very much to write home about.

Bottle 330ml (alc. 3.9%, AIH40)

Clear golden color, small white head. Light grassy, limey aroma. Light bodied and watery. Mineral water feeling. Corn and iron in the flavor. Duh.

Bottle 355ml. clear glass.

 [ As Corona Light ].
ABV: 3.9%. Clear light to medium yellow color with a average to large, frothy, good lacing, mostly lasting, white head. Aroma is moderate malty, pale malt, corn, light vegetables. Flavour is light moderate sweet with a average duration, sweet malt, corn, sharp grass notes. Body is light to medium, texture is watery, carbonation is soft. [20141025]
Bottle @ fonefan tasting. 3.9 % ABV. Clear pale yellow with a small white head. Aroma is sweet, light malty and grainy. Flavor is medium sweet. Sweet finish. Watery. 251014

Corona Light is a good beer. Has a great smell and (for me) a great summer taste. 

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone
355 ml bottle with a slice of lime. Clear light light light golden. Smell is light lime from the lime slice. Taste is carbonated water with a slice of lime. No bitterness and high carbonation.

Transfer from BA review on 8-9-12 - 
 Poured from bottle into pint glass

 Appearance – Pours a very light golden color with a medium head that fades almost instantaneously to leave almost no lacing.

 Smell – The aroma is a mix of skunk, paper, and corn. Not to appetizing.

 Taste – The taste begins watery with a very stale bready flavor. While not too appealing at first, the flavor only diminishes from there. Flavors of a stale corn flavor come to the tongue along with a papery and skunky flavor. In the end a very unpleasant flavor is left on the tongue.

 Mouthfeel – Thin and watery with a high level of carbonation. While the carbonation helps hide the bad flavor the wateriness is just a little too intense. Somehow it seems even more water then water itself.

 Overall – I have always been told when you have nothing nice to say then say nothing at all, so…… (although I probably already said more bad things then I should have, but…)

DATE TASTED: September 1, 2013 ... GLASSWARE: Warsteiner pokal... OCCASION: celebrating the last Sunday before school begins...APPEARANCE: wateresque in density; champagne-like bubbles cascade swiftly; thin, liquid white head...not bad... AROMA: funky off-kilter cardboard (!) and some lemony zest--odd without the lime...otherwise, flat and malty...PALATE: soft, spritzy and extremely drinkable as a light ought to be...little aftertaste...TASTE: not much apart from the soft malts--more likely, corn and rice... OVERALL: a tickling rinse of sunshine that, in the right context, is pleasing if only because it is fleeting, and the repetition is encouraged by the beer’s absent character...out of context, minimal calories that could still be better spent eating a Dorito or two...

It surely deserves its place among Ratebeer’s 50 worst beers in the world.
It’s fine when drinking a cold light beer at a party.  I prefer it over lots of other light beers, actually, as it’s not skunky and doesn’t leave a sweet, mealy aftertaste.
Pours a very light and clear gold with little head. Crappy beer. It smells and tastes like water mixed with fermented hay from the bottom of a horse stall.
Corny malt aroma. Hardly any flavour. Pale odd colour. Very, very, very meh.

Bottle.  Pretty bad, even for post hockey game beers.  This one caught me by surprise at how bad and undrinkable it was.  Out of a cooler full of Coors Light, Miller Lite, Molson Canadian, and Bud Light, I plucked this one out randomly, and this was the only one I couldn’t finish, and warranted pitching over the fence.  One of the worst beers I’ve ever tasted.

Can. Pours light yellow with a thin fizzy white head that dissipates rapidly with no lacing. Aroma is grain, honey and metal. Taste is grain and honey, with a lightly bitter metallic finish. Not good, but not actually gross.
Like carbonated water with a blade of grass or two. I’d choose it over the other staple light beers, though.
Bottle @ JFK, NYC. Medium head with medium duration. Color is golden. Aroma and taste are corn, malt and hops.
Not my favorite beer, but pretty good for a hot day. Better with a lime...............

Pale island lager. Not bad for day in sun at park or pool. Drinkable. Clean and light. Not awful

---Rated via Beer Buddy for iPhone

Bottle.  Left over from some summer gathering.  In the clear bottle this is a pale yellow color.  There is little aroma, some sweetness and a bit of skunk.  Pretty fizzy palate and minimal flavor especially at the beginning.  There is a bit of hop bitterness at the end but no real hop flavor.  Okay on a hot day but that’s about it.
Paired with a hot dog. Light yellow pour with a fizzy white head. Light malt flavor and aroma with a bit of lemon zest and some metallic bitterness in the finish.
Golden pissy water aroma.  Aroma of hay and urine.  Taste of hay and paper.  Fairly smooth.. a bit dull and flattish.
Straight from the Bottle. Aroma is macro lager with some of the aroma from the lime in the glass. The taste is very watery and has very little flavor. At last its cold since its so hot.
Had at a friends house for fajita night.  Pale color, barely any smell, slight bitterness in taste, better than I expected, but not very good.

Pretty standard pale lager.  Compared to fellow Mexican pale lager Modelo Especial, it’s lacking in flavor.  Smell is also less pleasant than Modelo’s.  Not much going on here at all - no wonder a citrus fruit like lemon or lime is usually added to this beer.

Rerated 20131210 (why?)- aromas of boiled vegetables, some citrus. OK bitterness


Backlog Mexico january 2011 Bought/tasted at combined bar/shop The Beer Box in Playa del Carmen, tasted on bottle.

Very light in all considerations, watery
Not impressive
I really don’t like light beers but a light version of my favorite beer, it is ok if i have to. without a lime this is awful.

Wonder why some people even bother to rate a beer when their whole intention is to bash it... Why even drink it? If you don’t like a pale lager and don’t understand the style, don’t drink it. Anyway... Poured into a pint glass, very well carbonated, pale yellow. Nose is skunky with some lime notes. Super light and easy to drink with some good citrus and lime flavors. Very drinkable for a lighter beer.
Cuatro de Mayo!!! Shitty beer that tastes like funny-smelling seltzer water that happens to get you drunk. Barely beer.
12oz bottle pours pale yellow with a white head.  Aromas of straw hay and some slight malt.  Flavor is plain with some malt sweetness. Body is light and finished clean
There is a reason they give you a lime.  It helps cover the, skunky taste of this "beer"
12oz can pours very pale yellow almost clear with a thin white head. Aroma is faint rice and straw mainly. Flavor is sweet and watery. Body is really light and finish is weak

tasted like regular corona to me Fizzy yellow water, no head. Aroma of sweet corn meal, some grass. Just like a Pale Lager should. Taste of mineral water, some hay and cereal malt. Very thin, too simple, and definitely not Corona Extra.
Not as good as regular Corona, but again if you want a light beer, you could do worse.
If you are looking for a light beer, you can definitely do better than this. Both coors and budlight are better than this IMO.
I knew this would be bad, but this was worse than I thought. Nasty skunky aroma. Clear, barely yellow colour with rapidly vanishing head. Taste is slightly sweet, but mostly water. Gross.
A lighter version of the regular corona if that is possible. Not sure why you would drink this instead of water.
Bottle consumed during vacation, pale yellow with no aroma and flavor, well, some lime comes through because I jammed a large piece in the bottle, tick.

Poured into a pint glass without tilting it to get as much head on it as possible. For five seconds it had a finger of head. It looked nice with a clear straw color. However, within 30 seconds (I timed it) the head was nil.

A mild (MILD) malty smell. The metallic smell dominates.

Tastes like water but with a bad aftertaste. No beer flavor notes to speak of. If I licked a sheet of metal, that would accurately describe the latter part of the flavor profile.

Mouthfeel fits the style but not as crisp. Lots of bubbles, too much for me. Light body.

There are many parts of the world were I would drink this over the local water supply, but if there is a different beer I would go with the latter.
Even less tasty than the regular Corona. Like drinking a bad hoppy water. If you are thirsty enough, you’ll drink it.

Bottle @ Timbers, Denver. Pours very light yellow, small white head. Barely any aroma, just hints of malt, corn, lemon. Thin watery taste, have to look hard for notes of malt and lemon. Thin watery body, lively carbonation. Taste like a thin beer watered down. 200212
This is probably the worst beer I ever had. I should have turned it down. Add six limes at least. Watery taste and body.
Light straw color; Light body; Aroma & flavor of some hops, grain/corn, and cereal; Way too light for me; What’s the point - isn’t regular Corona light enough?
Weak beer and like the Corona Lemon, Limes, or salt is needed to cover up the bad taste.  This is okay at times and near nasty as it always tastes skunked to me.
12 oz bottle pour yellow with a white head.  Not much to say except it taste watery and has a sweet aroma.
Always thought I had rated this one. Had a skunky bottle. Like skunky water.
All the lack of taste of regular Corona, only less so. At least with the ubiquitous lime you end up with a decent thirst quencher.
If you run out of soda water when making cocktails, you can use this in a pinch. Devoid of all positives, except the alcohol.

Originally rated November 2005. Tonight, I am pulling off a Tropical Beerfest. Looks exciting... I know. All I am doing is comparing, one after the other, 4 brews that are tropical lagers. It is a great night to do this, as I am freezing my ass inside the house. Pours a very pale yellow colour and carbonation is very active. Some light foamy lacing. The skunk is smelt as soon as I pop the cap off. Less skunky a few minutes into it, and more on the malt side. No lemon, nor lime is found in this one, as I am reviewing the beer, not the social aspect of it. Very refreshing with its water mouthfeel. Not much in the taste, just a touch of grain malt in the aftertaste. Nothing offensive here, but just too light. Don’t know why this brew exists, as Corona itself is light enough. Ah well.

Bottle @ home. Fuck, I found this hiding in the back of my fridge. I must have picked it up in a mixer sixer and exiled it to the back of the fridge. Light, clear, golden appearance with a small white head. A touch of lime, slightly citrusy, light pale malty aroma. Very light bodied, very light pale malty, mild citrusy flavor. I really didn’t think this was that much worse than Corona but it seems like that right now.
Stick with Corona Extra. This is fermented water at its finest. There isn’t enough lime juice in the world to save this beer.

Bottle. Aroma is awful, skunk malt grain and metal. Taste is substantially better. I’d say this is probably one of the best high-alcohol bottles of water I’ve ever had. Finally an alcoholized water that tastes just like water with a slight hint of malt. I’d rather drink this than competing beers like Coors and BL which have awful metallic tastes. This is smooth. Overall though, it’s still water and not really a beer....Meh...Again it’s better than most commonly available light beers. Unoffensive but disappointing.

Bottle in Sterling, Virginia. Pale gold with slight carbonation. Watery, with a hint of stale corn and cardboard. Basically inoffensive when drunk ice cold but became increasingly unpleasant as the temperature rose. I should really leave beers like this well alone.

Aroma: what aroma? it smells faintly of wheat

Appearance: Yellow, no head... just yellow.

Taste: It had a taste? 

Palate: well having no aroma and no taste it sure is easy to drink

Overall: bland, bland to the extent i feel like writing a review that may be viewed as simple hate for the brand. But i have to be honest if you want something that is just easy to drink then fine grab one just not the Vodka is far cheaper and has more flavor despite it’s intent to lack flavor.
Bottle. Clear light yellow pour with no head. Aroma and taste of watery corn. Super light and boring. A touch of skunk here as well.
Bottle. Yellow colour with a white head. What is there to say about this that nobody knows? Do not taste much, but refreshing in the sun. Thats all, and that is what you want sometimes.
Bottle. What I could normally drink ice cold, on a beach or a boat, with a lime inserted through the neck and gently tilted, has been totaly F-ed up by creating this crappy light beer.

Bright golden yellow pour this thin to minimal white lacing. Nose is sweet bready malt. The major difference in comparison to its Corona Heavy counterpart seems to be the mouthfeel and palate. Corona Light is much more noticeably watery which doesn’t really work as well with the bready, malty flavor profile. The thin mouthfeel also adds a bit of a "papery" or crackery feel which isn’t that great. If this was the only option at a bar, I’d probably go with water, honestly.
Color amarillo muy muy claro, sin aroma, sin espuma, nada de cuerpo. Una cerveza para ir al baño muchas veces y realmente nada de alcohol. Como agua de uso.

Drank directly from bottle. Straw color with weak white foam. Fizzy and cold with a dry lager finish, that’s it. Adjunct corn off-taste. Weaker color, aroma, flavor, body, and alcohol percentage than Corona Extra. Barely a beer at all.

Take an already crappy beer and make it worse. That’s the story of this beer. Aroma is sweet corn and skunk. Pour was a nice light gold with plenty of rising bubbles and a 1 finger white head. Taste was weak watery and skunky. There is a light corn flavor that makes it seem too sweet for a light beer. Nice strong carbonation. You have to go to Mexico to find one of these beers that is not skunked, not a good brew.
Pours a watery yellow with fizzy white head. This has the typical skunky flavor of Corona, only more watery- Pass
This light mexican beer is easy to drink without much to distiguish it. Great with a lime

Seemed to lack the skunkiness of the regular version. Drinkable on a hot summer day at parties and BBQ’s Almost no flavor at all save a mild corn taste with mild sourness. Finishes dry & refreshing which I’m sure contributes to it’s popularity. Being a bland beer it seems to lack any major offensive qualities.
To tell you the truth, I can’t really pinpoint a difference between this and regular corona. They both taste like mexican piss

3.7%, really!?! - bottle into a pint glass - pours pale yellow with no head.  Aroma is skunk.  Taste is lightly bitter.  Palate is watery and that’s about it.  Quite refreshing!  Very non-offensive beer and easy to drink, but hardly has any character.

Thin watery and bland, This actually had a very putrid taste, but my brother in laws brother was so porud to have these for the weekend get together, I didn’t want to hurt his feelings too bad.

STay away!

A: The pour on this is a pale yellow color with a towering white head.

S: How I love the smell of skunk and corn.  Lots of metallic notes are also there, as is a fair amount of apple juice.  There’s also quite a bit of sulfur to it, which is never a good thing.

T: Strong sulfur and skunk flavors, unfortunately, but not surprisingly.  Metal is a prominent flavor as is sweet corn and apple juice.  Light grassy hops and bitterness.

M: Light in body with a medium to high level of carbonation.

O: Not sure which is worse, this or regular Corona.  Not sure it really matters, either.

350 ml bottle from my mothers frige in New York. Pours a light gold with almost no head. Aroma is light skunk and huge corn and graininess. Taste is about like the description. 30% less calories and 30% less flavor, 30% less everything. Starts off pure water with some grain and skunk in the finish. Why did anyone bother even making this? Why?
I had a bottle on the golf course, just to rate it.  Why???  How is this beer and its sister Corona ranked in the top ten beers sold in this country.

Bottle from Thai supermarket. Pours a light yellow fizzy body, whose beginning head is more or less instantly evaporated as the drink settles in the glass. Nose is vague tones of pale malts. Taste is vague tones of pale malts plus lots of water. Thin, watery mouthfeel. Corona Light: just when you thought it couldn’t get any more watery. No flaws though; this is just a beer for people who’d like to get drunk on water.

Not sure how this gets such a good score from me, but I drank it from the bottle @ my Tiki bar. So its a nice light refreshing summer beer with what I think is milder than regular Corona so it actually tastes better!

Appearance - Very pale yellow. Pours with some carbonation (about a finger). Can see right through a full glass of this beer.

Smell - None really to speak of. Smells faintly of some hops, but that is all.

Taste - Largely tasteless with a bitter bite at the end indicative of some hop content in the beer. Some faint rice or grain notes. Preferable taste over Budweiser or Bud Light, but trumps not many other beers. Leaves the mouth and enters the throat dry (hops).

Mouthfeel - Watery. No body to speak of. Some carbonation note while in the mouth.

Overall - Not a very good beer. If you are drinking to get intoxicated cheaply and do not want to totally hate the experience, probably a good beer. Would prefer Yuengling for the latter task, but I might be biased being from Tampa and all (Yuengling distillery in Tampa).
Almost a lager flavored water. At least it is not slinky in its taste. Light yellow color.

Bottle.  Nothing to note taste or smell wise besides a little skunk and some sweetness which is why if ever one of these are handed to me I immediately stuff a lime in it.  A tad worse than the full version.  Still it reminds me of the beach and summertime which is not a bad thing.

Can at Ungstrup, huge thanks to yespr for bringing this :-)
Clear yellow coloured with a small white head.
Sweet aroma of malts and corn.
Sweet flavour of corn.
Very watery.

Pours a pale golden yellow color with a one finger white foam head that quickly fizzles away into a lasting ring. Not much in the way of lacing. Not the best looking beer but I’ve had plenty of "craft" beers that look mucher paler/worse.

The aroma is pretty bad but the lighter version of this beer kind of waters things down making them less offensive. Faint stale faded hops with lots of grain and corn. Not very pleasant.

Light bodied but again, not as pale or light as the reviews make it out to be. The flavornis pretty bad with faint hop bitterness followed by an odd metallic flavor along with hints of grainy adjuncts. Lots of corn flavor. I hate putting fruit in beer but adding a lime actually improves this beer giving it a sweet citrus flavor. That bein said you shouldn’t have to add fruit to a beer to improve it’s taste. Pretty bad but not entirely offensive and easy to drink in hot weather. The scores are really terrible for this beer but I’m not sure they’re entirely warranted.
Can 50cl at Ungstrups - thanks. Clear yellow - white head. Corn. White sugar. Alcho Reduced. CO2. What a "beer".

clear yellow, smooth white head.
malty and slightly citrussy aroma.
flavor is watery, malty, flowery bittereess, low on flavor.
Bottle at Ungstrup’s - Thanks. Pours a clear quite pale yellow with a tiny white head. Sweet with malty hints. Light bodied. Medium carbonation. Thinnish. Watery.

Can. A light yellow beer with a thin white head. The aroma has notes of grain and metal. The flavor is sweet with notes of metal, leading to a dry metallic finish. Huge thanks to my friend yespr for bringing this home to me.
330ml bottle. This was pretty much like a regular Corona, only weaker and skunkier.
One of the better beers to come out of Mexico.  Pairs great with a slice of lime, of course.

WTH? All I could taste here was the lime. I’ll have to try this one without the lime, so that I can rate it on its actual taste, wherever that may be hiding. But when a friend buys this for me in a bar in New York because I have no ID, well who am I to complain?

A - Grain and skunky
A - Light yellow with thin white head
T - Slightly sweet and bitter
P - Thin
O - Bring on the summer
33 cL can. Pours clear and golden orange with a small white head. Aroma is cornish and grainy. Bitter, cornish and light bitter. Dry and bitter finish. Works in the heat.
Not very good at all unless with a lime fresh out of the cooler. Even on a hot day, it’s not very desireable. This is nearly as weak in every category as a beer can be.

Corona Light has a thin, white head and a clear, straw appearance with a good amount of bubbles streaming up the glass. The aroma is bready, yeasty, and toasty. Taste is a predominance of lightly-toasted barley malt and there is a trace of hop bitterness. Mouthfeel is light and watery, and Corona Light finishes crisp, mild, refreshing, and dry. Overall, I was surprised by this one. Groupo Modelo hit the target. For a light beer, this is damn good (and, I’m not one who cares too much for light beer).

RJT
Refrigerated bottle clear pale straw color.  Medium body, no lacing, no carbonation, and virtually no head.  Taste is light malt and a hint of skunk.  The lime is needed, session beer only.
Bottle in Miami Airport. Pale yellow, no head. Mild lemon aroma. Dry bland citrus flavour. Watery & sharp with bitter aftertaste. Not good.

This beer is almost like drinking water. Water is more satisfying though. The only way to get through it is to make sure it is ice cold and drink it as fast as possible. And really what is the point of that. The only reason I would drink this is if it was the only beer available, and even then I may pass.
Bright gold with lots of bubbles, and a full head that doesn’t last. Not much flavor or aroma - maybe some biscuity notes. Drinkable, though.

When Regular Corona is just too bold and flavorful!  Pours Piss Yellow with a fizzy head no thicker than an 8 year old’s pinky finger.  Very slight hint of corn.  Taste?  What taste?  You’d need the entire lime to add a hint of flavour to this bad boy.  I’m new here, is there any way to lower these ones to zero’s?

Blah. Take an already crappy beer and make it worse. That’s the story of this beer. Aroma is sweet corn and skunk. Pour was a nice light gold with plenty of rising bubbles and a 1 finger white head. Taste was weak watery and skunky. There is a light corn flavor that makes it seem too sweet for a light beer. Nice strong carbonation. Terrible

Reviewed from notes. Poured into a pint glass.

Pours a transparent golden color with a lot of carbonation and really not much of a white head. The nose is a bit skunky with some really, really light grain. The taste is just about nothing. Lightly-skunked hops and some faint grain husks. Very light with high carbonation. This tastes bad.

Serving type: bottle

Reviewed on: 11-14-2010
drank from a 12 fl. oz. glass bottle, almost no flavor, regular much preferred, had w/o lime

24oz can.  Fizzy yellow water, no head.  Aroma of sweet corn meal, some grass.  Just like a Pale Lager should.  Taste of mineral water, some hay and cereal malt.  Very thin, too simple, and definitely not Corona Extra.

Before I get into Corona Light, I would just like to say that I appreciate Corona Extra. Y’all can hate me for it, but I really do. That said, its little sister Corona Light is just not up to snuff. I will give it closer to middle marks for aroma and taste, because it at least doesn’t taste bad, but having mentioned that, it doesn’t taste like anything. It goes in with nothing and leaves nothing behind. Like Extra, and disagree if you will, it looks like a million bucks, golden, with a quickly settling head when from the bottle. In closing, the gloves are coming off here, and I will be really crass, does anyone else have the problem of not being able to get drunk off this stuff or is that just me?
Petite bouteille, cannette. Sérieux ? Sérieusement pas obligé d’avoir une version light de cette bière au gout déjà assez light.

Appearance: Clear pale straw with a ever so fading white lace.

Smell: Odd aroma of sweetness and grain ... creamed corn? Hint of sulfur and no apparent skunkiness or anything!

Taste: Crisp, clean and light bodied with some grainy husky flavours that are mildly astringent yet get a little stronger. Hop bitterness is minimal and the husky astringency builds up more in the end. Finish is quite dry and a bit coarse.

Notes: Did this brew come from the second running or pressings of the mash? On second thought maybe one should put the lime in this brew to mask the astringent off flavors. Afterall lime water is good and this "brew" does taste a lot like water!!  Worst beer EVER!!!
why make a light version of corona?  it’s basically water anyway...corn and water.  it goes down like water, and i’m convinced it lacks alcohol.
This beer makes a bad beer worse by removing some of the alcohol. And it preserves the ability to be skunky by the clear bottles.
Pours straw with thin white head and minimal lacing.  Skunky aroma.  Taste is weak and off-balance.  Crisp, but in need of the lime they usually servie with it.
Skunky aroma.  Golden in color with white head.  Just a lighter version of the regular Corona.
Not my style of beer but I drank it anyway. Beer is extremely light tasting and has minimal flavor

12oz bottle. This is the very first beer I ever drank in my life. It was served with the typical lime slice on the top. Simply awful. Now I can conciously affirm that this is simply not beer. Or at least not for real.
Very typical light beer, almost no flavour, light colour, poor beer, I would prefer a lot of other light beers over this
Straight 3’s, homey. Bottle offered up after a game, went down quick and easy on a chilly afternoon. If you pretend this is a soft drink it works just fine. Fizzy, moderately beer flavored. Chug!

I’m more fascinated by the "light" beer style than anything else... I think it’s a social pressure thing, that people want to be seen drinking beer even though they hate beer. Or, they think they will get drunk too fast and need a beer that is unintrusive. Either way, the light beers fill a market need and who are we to deny them the opportunity to cash in on people too narcissistic to just order soda water with vodka? Thus, I pour this at room temperature - the only way to truly taste the varying flavours of a light beer - it pours a urine yellow with almost no head. Aroma of sweetened carboard and a bit of candy that you found under the couch cushions one friday night while drunk. Flavour is water with a weak grainy-cardboard aftertaste. Seriously, is their answer to the "light" question to just make it more watery? Poor showing, Corona. You suck.
Sampled from a bottle. Pours straw yellow with no head, very bubbly. Tastes same as Corona Extra, just more water down.
Bottle served with a lime wedge. Kinda pointless as a beer as Corona is light as it is. The lime has more going on than the liquid in this bottle. Very watery and lacking flavor.

Appearance: light straw with no head. In fact, no foam or lace or head whatsoever. Swirls pitifully.


Nose: could smell the cheap adjuncts during pour. Fizzy and mineralistic. Lemon peel, wet crackers, wonder bread crust. Spritzy; hard minerals and limestone.


Palate: nasty. Very fizzy and bubbly with excessive hard carbonation. Minerally. Lemon and key lime skin, dry and old. Wet wonderbread finish. Hard minerals brillo the back of tongue with each quaff, painful. Grows very bitter with hard dry stale citric skins. Salty.


Final Thoughts: supposedly there is a market or a need for beers like this, but personally I don’t see any other market or need for them other than the need to market them to make money. They don’t taste good if and when they actually taste at all so really, all that is left is the mass-marketing machine and the masses they have culled into swallowing every bit of consumerism they put out. Not me, thank you very much.

Post party ’fridge find. Y’know, we all know that putting a lime in a Corona is the mark of a dilletant (sp), but I think I may have been looking at this the wrong way. The fact is, a single lime wedge just isn’t enough. What I have found is that it takes about half a lime to mask the awful smell and flavor, and has the bonus of giving it some color. So the next time you are at DUIFridays and your waitress, Misty, asks you if you’d like a lime wedge to go with your Corona Light, look her straight in the eye and say "No Ma’am! bring me half a lime, and a juicer!" You can thank me later.

355 ml can from LCBO.  Pours a pale yellow with lots of big bubbles but virtually no head.  Light, grainy vaguely beer-like aroma.  Taste is simple and grainy with some adjunct but not particularly skunky (it’s almost like a can works better than a clear bottle).  Thin body and virtually no finish.  Very bad but there are worse.
It might as well be water with a lime in a bottle. This beer is horrible. Nothing else sums it up better.
bottle thanks to thirdeye11.  pale yellow, ring of white.  nose is fruity malts and light cardboard.  thin palate, more corn, fruity malts, and cardboard.
Why bother?  If this is beer, I’m the King of the World.  Sort of a beer taste, little aroma.  Super-pale yellow.  Massively underwhelming.

The best thing about this beer is the color.  The light golden color tells me it is not a beer to be afraid of.  Other than that I don’t have much to say about this beer.  It smells like beer and tastes like beer.  It is definitely drinkable but not a favorite.
Bottle. Its like Corona.. with even less flavor.. is this possible? Apparently you take a Kolsh and instead of watering it down 100:1 (Corona) you up it to 200:1. Beer? bad Water?

12 ounce bottle - $1.49 at Total Wine & More in Kennesaw, Georgia.

Appearance: Pours out a clear, thin-looking, pale yellow body with a foamy layer of white suds on top, though this soon dies down.

Smell: Jesus, what is going on with that scent, it smells particularly skunky with a big whiff of rotten eggs. It’s no wonder I’ve put off revisiting this beer for so many years.

Taste: Barely a hint of insipid barley grain up front, with a touch of corn-based sweetness, no real hop character or bitterness, but a troublesome metallic bent to it. Small crackle of carbonation on the weak, less-than-clean finish.

Mouthfeel: Thin-bodied with a mouthfeel that is quite watery.

Drinkability: Unclean and unpleasant. I certainly couldn’t fault anyone for chucking a lime into this, or even the adding salt thing I occasionally people engaging in, ’cause this beer needs some help.
A must for cinco de mayo. Throw a lime in and it easily jumps up at least a point in ratings
To be fair, you don’t really lose anything by going light with a beer like this. Not much character, but excellent on a hot day.

Drinking straight from 12oz, can’t imagine this is any better in a glass, color is translucent straw. Aroma is grassy and boozy. No lime here taste is grassy at best, alcohol, grain. With a lime there is a lot more flavor, which is kinda sad you have to add anything for this to be tolerable. However, I wouldn’t turn one down on a hot day, beats a lot of domestic swill.

330ml bottle 
3.7% ABV 
I tried this beer on August 10, 2010 after purchasing for $0.50 from the singles bin at one of my local LCBO outlets. The beer poured a translucent gold colour with a bubble white head that quickly dissipated. The aroma was grass, with some weak floral hops, and skunk. The mouthfeel was extremely thin bodied, with medium carbonation. The flavour was god awful. Very acidic, and sour grainy malt. Not a fan of Corona or Corona Light but if you need to choose between the two...the Corona is FAR better, although that’s not saying much
Bottle.  Dear god, Corona is light to begin with.  WTF?  Truthfully, tastes and smells pretty much the same as a regular Corona, which isn’t saying much.  Avoid this, if possible.
So bad. Bought a 12 pack on sale, and wondering how long it’s gonna sit in the fridge. Corona Extra is bearable, but the Light is unbearable for me.
Poured super pale straw yellow with little to the nose, pretty much dirty tap water. taste was just as thin.
(bottle). Clear gold color. Medium white head. Light grain aroma. Flavor of the same, but watery/diluted. Short duration. Light dry finish. Thin texture. Soft carbonation. Spare lacing.
Bottle. Straw yellow color with weak head. Aroma and flavor of grass, hay, and oats. Great thirst quencher with low ABV so can drink lots of it on a hot day.

My girlfriend bought this. Clear golden piss color. Smells like skunky piss. Tastes like regular corona, maybe watered down a bit. Would drink this on the beach but not really anywhere else. And only if it was all that was available. Adding a lime doesn’t help.

(12oz bottle) clear, pale, very few bubbles. Nose of sugar, skunk and grain. Taste of earth, skunk, bitterness is weird. Thickish body due to lack of carbonation so the finish is syrupy. Linger of ass. Nasty.
355ml bottle. Hard to tell the difference from regular Corona. Relatively bright in colour with malty aroma and basic uninteresting flavour. Serves its purpose as an easy drinking session beer.
I told myself I wasn’t going to be so harsh as to give 1’s on everything to any beer...but this is not a beer.  This, to me, is an abomination.
Had this at a party recently...WITH LIME...so you know it’s good.  Basically tastes like water.  Just plain bad.
Similar in most ways to corona but is more watery but also less skunky because taste is muted.  Ice cold with lime allows this to work at beach.
Well, it’s Corona, and it’s a Light beer, which makes this a very wrong beer.
light yellow piss color, no head, smells like dirty laundry, mild taste of lemon with a sweet note

(12oz bottle, courtesy of thirdeye11)  Pours a clear pale yellow body with a small white head.  Aroma of skunk, Play-Doh, grain, and light lemon.  Flavor of skunk, grain, metallic with a dry finish.  Horrid and needs a lime for sure.
(Bottle)  My wife bought this and I was thirsty.  Let’s face it, when it’s over 90 degrees outside, you want an ice cold one.  This is water to me.
Drinkable? Yes. Enjoyable? No. There is nothing to it except a little hint of a cheap tasting beer. I personally would prefer Coors over this any day.

was given a little slim can of this. Why did they have to bother with making a light version of one of the lightest beers in the world? slight yellow tinged urine color with lots of bubbles and a little head. The aroma was a bit of corn. The taste...........did not exist. I was very tired and very warm from being outside, only reason I could excuse this travesty to myself.

Almost tasteless.   Water with a hint of corn & skunk.
This is a beer for people who don’t like beer.
too light and nondescript. the regular corona is light enough and is respectable because of its cooling ability and its notorious pairing with lemon and lime, tequila ect. redundant.

Pour form 24 oz can. Fain skunky aroma, lighter shade of pale yellow, not much flavor to speak of. At least the brewer is honest when they say it tastes the same as Corona Extra. Though I might say it tastes as bad as...  Point off the overall for the de minimus alcohol level...

12oz bottle given to me by a lady friend.  I can see why she would drink this, its mild, smooth, bland, low calories, and low alcohol.  Watery, but not raw seltzer water like the American lights (Natural, Coors, Miller).  At 3.7% ABV its barely enough alcohol for me to consider it even a beer,  but that’s a plus if you have to drive or need to stay sober.  Better than I had feared, and a welcome refresher on a miserably hot Florida day.  Still, I can’t imagine that I would ever actually buy this swill.
preffered over extra light isnt as podent due to watered down but in my own opinion thats how I rather have it.
Clear, pale yellow with no head. Very watered down beer. Natural Light is better than this!

Why on earth would you drink a light version of a terrible beer? Nice marketing campaign, with the secluded beach in Mexico idea, but it’s a vacation, not punishment. I would never serve and would have to have to accept this beer. Avoid.

A watered down version of Corona? Yes Please!  
Same straw pour with a fizzy light head.  Aroma is lighter skunk than corona extra but more water and wet cardboard.  A touch corny sweet.  
Mouthfeel is watery 
Flavor is more of that familiar wet cardboard and a flutter of skunk.  
Worse than the Original.  Yikes
33 cl bottle. Definetely a bad beer, I didn’t like it. One of the worst beers ever tried.
Drink this beer for Cinco De Mayo, beach get aways, pool side, depressed and wanting to be by water. Great with or without a lime.
Clear as glass, light as piss. Aroma has notes of a potentially good lager, but the taste disappoints. Not much to show here, medium carbonation, minimal flavor.
Crystal clear, pale yellow, medium carbonation with a small white head. Taste is smooth but weak.

12 oz bottle into English pint. Aroma is skunky, full of adjunct grain. Pours pale yellow with minimal head, okay lacing. Flavor is salty; no bitterness whatsoever. Tastes like your average cerveza. Medium carbonation. Bland.
Water.  Check that, stale water.  Even an added lime can’t save this abomination to the liquid universe.

light golden with a fizzy head that disappears.  smell is metallic, light sweetness. extremely light taste, notes of actual water in it, sudden harsh dirt taste, more water. feel alternates between strange grit and slight substance. ha this is insane

Bottle. This beer pours a straw yellow color, with weak head. Aroma and flavor of grass, hay, and oats. I do like the fact that it tastes similar to corona extra, and therefore saves me calories. I notice little difference between the two, which doesn’t say much for corona extra.
12 ounce bottle at friends reunion (which means didn’t have to pay for this), As bad as usual.

Does this beer really need to exist? Isn’t Corona light enough? I recently was wrestling with this question and I wondered if I could even tell them apart. After a blind taste test I could, but neither beer are special or decent.

Poured from a bottle into a standard pint glass. No salt, Lucas, or citrus added, just the naked beer. Beer is light yellow and completely clear. No head or lacing to speak of, moderate to high carbonation made up of medium to large bubbles.

Almost no aroma. Some grains, maybe.

Gross. This beer really bothers me. It is worse than Corona Extra, that much I know from a side by side, but this beer has a terrible grainy flavor and has the consistency of water. Never again.
Not much to say here, Corona didn’t have much taste or alcohol before now they lightened it more? Not sure how, but the straw/corn/cereal taste is a bit less and a bit more watery.  No thanks.

Well, the ad campaign is true... this is in fact the only light beer that is also a Corona. Has all the taste of a Corona... well maybe a little less and the negligible amount of alcohol doe not help this beer. Overall a mediocre crappy beer, but not deserving of the 0 percentile thing. BTW, I didn’t pay for this beer... rather grabbed it at a Holiday party.

Bottled. Almost as bad as Bud light, this piss colored brew has sweet hop light aroma. And a bland paper thin palate with nothing more than a dab of corn/fake malt in a bucket of water. ooh the horror
Same as corona, but how did they lighten a light beer in the first place. weird. I don’t get it...alcohol sure but really! Come on!

The same thing I say about corona extra I say about this...Its golden yellow its light it looks like it glows in the dark, small head good with a lime.... ETC... What else can I say its corona. But just its corona light!

I’ve only given this beer a 2 for appearance because it is more or less what it is supposed to be for the style. Light straw. Aside from that, i find few if any redeeming qualities. There are plenty of beers out there that taste worse, but few that are rewarded with such huge sales, so I feel the need to single out this beer. 

My wife insists on drinking it, to my total dismay, for no apparent reason other than the look of the bottle and the international trend of adding a lime to make it taste like something... anything. It is a beer geared for profit only, a marketing creation, made with the cheapest possible ingredients, high in rice and corn, low in malt and hops. Aroma and flavour are almost negligible. It is rivaled only by Bud Light in it’s bland watery tastelessness.

I ran out of beer during a halloween party next door. I saw that I have not rated this, so I thought I would try this for shits and giggles. Typical pale lager appearance and aroma. Prickly carbonation and a soda like mouthfeel. Flavor of your typical adjucts and grains, but with more cheapness to it’s counterparts and definitely more watery. More bland than Corona, and that’s a good thing. There is a reason people but limes in this-to cover up the cheap, weak flavor in order to make this halfway drinkable.
12 oz. bottle.  Light, sweet citrus flavor.  Somehow it tastes like there’s a lime in the beer even though there isn’t.  Should probably only be drank at the beach or poolside.
330ml bottle - pours a weak yellow. An even weaker version of Corona Extra. Terrible.

My nose tells me that there is some hops in here somewhere though it looks like it might have been added in a clear, lab-produced hop flavoured synthetic cocktail. You can taste the hops too, but only barely, and it doesn’t really make it taste good, it’s just another thing in the way of the fermenting straw taste. There is some fizz on the tounge..??? sort of...

Pours clear yellow. Slight head no retention at all. NO dicernable aroma. And it really tastes like nothing at all. It is a little fizzy and that is about it. It seems crazy to me that this beer even exists. I mean for Gods sake wasn’t Corona regular light, boaring, clear and flavourless enough?!!!
Pours a clear bright yellow.  Taste is very watery and light.  Could be enjoyable on a hot summer day but would not go out of my way to drink.  Very little flavor, slight grain taste.
Bottle. Pours light gold with a thin head. A hint of sweetness in the aroma with some straw like notes. The flavor is bland, nothing overly offensive, with light notes of straw. Not awful.

For me this is simply a weaker version of Corona Extra. Similar except feels watered down and lacking substance. Some light fruit and grain present, and better than a lot of other yellow fizzy beers. Don’t bother without a lime.

Well, the only light beer that’s also a corona. Pours pale yellow with a smell white head even with a fairly aggressive pour. The aroma is sweet and slightly skunky. Apples and corn dominate the aroma, as well as the palate. Doesn’t taste any different from the regular, maybe a little waterier. Blah.

Well there’s not much to say about this one than what’s already been said about Carona Extra.  Pale yellow color.  Slight malty aroma.  Light malt taste.  Nothing much in the end.  I honestly think that this is the exact same thing as a Carona Extra and is a brilliant market scheme from the company.
12 oz. bottle- This is one of the worst beers i have ever had. Just as skunky as corona, but watered down to almost nothing. Tasteless skunky crap.
Always available at some tail gate party or get together. It’s not even like beer, more like a soda thats been watered down.

The narrow can reminds you right of the bat to keep your expectations contained. Pours to a yellow which both looks and smells of urine. The biggest let-down, though, is the alcohol content: sub 4% means you’ll actually have to drink More of these. And they’re $$$$. 
But, as we all know, if you’ve been buying Corona Light in the past, no review of the beer’s quality is going to stop you now.
Pale yellow color with no flavors or aromas to speak of.  Not even the lime could save this.
whoever buys corona light is an idiot. its not even good, like at all. not even corona extra is that impressive.
12 oz. bottle.  Same as a Corona but even lighter.  Once again, use a lime to drink this down easier.

Pour from the 12oz. bottle: Admittedly better than any American counterpart, needless to say it’s piss. At least it’s watered down, I guess... but at only 3.7% abv I have to drink a pack just to get a decent buzz. Overall: Ok... it’s more refreshing than the other macros sold at the local, family grocery store and less calories...yay. Rebuy: I’ll take it over a Miller Light or anything Bud sells any day.  #112 on 06092009, DG.

The lighter, worse version of Corona Extra. Corona Light is basically water compared to the already light Extra. There is next to no flavor in this beer unless a lime is added, in which case the lime is overpowering.
Pours clear yellow.  smells like beer and tastes like it with a nice Mexican flair.  Yumm-o.
Bottle. Everything I hate about Corona. Light. Pours like urine, smells the same. Someone destroy it. Utterly gross.
Was forced to drink for a summer mini-tour at Old Chicago... tastes like Corona with added water, which is a good thing because the flavor of Corona sucks.

Bottle. Pours a clear, very light yellow with thin fizzy white head. Not much aroma here but you do get some light hops. Flavor of watered down light malt and light hops, very light grain. Mouth feel is very light body and over carbonated. Overall, taste better then the American counter parts.

Serving: 12 oz. bottle.
Appearance: Light yellow with a foamy, white head.  The head was gone in seconds.
Aroma: Light aroma with some corn and lightstruck notes.
Taste: Light adjunct sweetness, very light bitterness.  Pretty tasteless overall.
Mouthfeel: Medium-high carbonation, very light mouthfeel, short finish.
Overall: This one is pretty tasteless.
Buy again: I wouldn’t, but I’ve also had worse.

12oz bottle.   Clear yellow with a small and dying white head.   Very faint indistinct sweetness in the aroma.   Very watery and light, but with less bad flavor than regular Corona, i.e. no skunk or hops to speak of.   Low in the bitterness, letting the little sweetness that remains dominate the palate with equal parts corn and seltzer water.   No lime this time, but it definitely helped the times that I have had this before.   Watery and fizzy, but that’s par right?   For a beach session brew to impress your yuppie friends, this is not a bad choice.   outrageously overpriced though.   Sorority girls love this one, incase you were wondering.

12fl oz bottle poured into a dimpled mug.  Clear gold with a very small diminishing head.  Aroma is skunk.  Flavor is corn and hops.  Watery.  Medium carbonation.  Finish is bitter and long.  Terrible.

Very light golden color...almost clear.  Thin head, though with good lacing.  Aroma is almost nonexistent.  Extremely mild flavor up front...crisp mouthfeel.  Lack of taste continues in the back...finish is dry.  The word "light" is definitely an understatement, as this brew is about as close to water as one can get.
Why oh why would you want watered down water??????? If its the calories you say, spare me....have a diet coke...

Bottle. Not going to lie, someone gave me this with a lime in it. I don’t think it affected my judgment though. Fairly weak beer, with no unique taste to it. Mostly taste like water, with a slight flavor of beer. Take a good beer, drink half of it, fill with water. This is what you get.
So take a Coron and water it down and that’s what you’ve got here.  Not a good beer.

Overall Impression: 
Re-read my rating of regular Corona and basically take out any reference to tasting anything other then a lime...

I would say it’s just a drop better on a super hot day then your average American Macro Light/Lite...

Wow.  Yeah, they tell you to put the lime in it so that you won’t taste the beer.  Serve it extra cold for less taste.  I heard the difference here is drinkability, oh wait... no that’s something else.  The funny part is the history-- this beer is a take on a Gernan style.  I guess if you can’t make it in a German community, then you take your business elsewhere.
I hated this beer. Had a terrible taste in my opinion. Butt then again, I am no fan of light beers.
The skinnier, uglier, dumber, younger brother of the extra.  Even worse than the original.
Nothing special. Very watered down and boring. Flavor is refreshing sometimes but would rather have the Corona Extra.

While this beer is not one I think of when I think of a good beer, it is one that I quite often go to on a hot day with a slice of lime.  Maybe it’s a california thing, but if I am hanging by the beach on a hot day or just workin in my backyard, this one seems to go down real easy.

Pour a light golden straw into the glass, with a nitrous-induced head that diminishes to nothing.  The nose is of skunky grains, emphasis on the "skunk".  The flavors are almost nonexistent, due to the far overcarbonated, thin seltzer mouthfeel, but do have some rare sort of skunk-hopped residue.  There is absolutely no substance to this brew, as it feels quite thrown-together hastily.  I don’t recommend it, and look downtrodden to my forthcoming trip to Mexico.  There HAS to be a better beer than this.....  almost a drain pour.

pours a golden transparent color with a thin white head.  Absolutely no depth because it taste like carbonated water.  Taste better with a lime though

12 oz. bottle
Extremely watered-down and just bad-tasting overall. For the price, you could get cheaper and better tasting beers. A lime is needed for me to even finish one of these.
Has less calories! Still tastes like mexican piss water! But at least I won’t get fat drinking it! Huzzah!!!!
12 oz bottle for cinco de mayo.... possibly worse than corona extra? absolutely.... awful terrible and bad

12 oz bottle, with a lime.  Aroma is a bit of corn and hay, a touch of malt.  Taste more of same.  Very crisp and clean mouthfeel, very quenching.  Nothing great, of course, but I could pound quite a few of these on a hot day!

Add a lime, and pretend you’re drinking water&lime, and you won’t really be disappointed. I drink it often, but not because I’m after a ’beer experience’.
aroma is weak and yeasty.
taste is watery to the Nth.
Completely boring, and yet, satisfying when you’re thirsty on the golf course or at the bowling alley.
Bottle.  Mild skunky aroma.  Yellow body, white head.  A hint of malt in the flavor, otherwise watery.  Carbonation adds some refreshment value.

This is the little brother of the horse piss know as Corona.  Well we have another beer here that is only drinkable with the assistance of a lime.
