These beers are shit, and that is probably too nice of a statement.  If you are looking for a lower calorie beer, look elsewhere.  Hell, even Genny Light knocks the socks off this piss.
clear bottle, clear yellow color with slight vegetal aroma, flavor is bland and fatty

"An overrated beer that isnt anything special but better than the light variety. not much taste or aroma."

Enough said
One of the only beers I will ever turn down. Tastes like water with a hint of pee.

Pours pale yellow with a small fizzy head that has almost no retention at all. Aroma is grass, adjunct, and manure... no joke. Flavor is luckily not as bad as the aroma but mainly dusty malt and a little hay, finish is nonexistent other than a sour malt coming through. Palate is thin, way over carbonated and neutral finishing, because this is water. This is a really terrible beer, don’t accept this beer even if it is free. Seriously even if you just want to get drunk, you would have to drink 20, and they would all taste bad.
Pale yellow pour, no head. Faint aroma of corn. What I expected, no surprises. Light.

Bottle. A clear pale yellow color with s very thin fizzy head,that quickly diminishes to nothing. Almost no aroma,faint grain and cheep rubbing alcohol. Flavor is almost nonexistant too, kind og a light fake fruit,some washed out grain and a hint of baby vomit,tossing in a lime wedge helped out a little.Thin watery body,lots of carbonation. A very low quality product at any price !
Very unoffensive. Absolutely no complexity. Balanced and light. I feel like I could drink eight of these without feeling anything.
I admit to having a few of these in high school, out on a lake.  Looking back, I can’t knock it, but I am just ratng this so I have a beer from Mexico.  This beer is what it is. . whatever.

Tasted like bread if I recall.  Very strange mouthfeel and aftertaste.  Not sure if a lime helps here or not. 2.6

RE-RATE 2/6/2011 Straight from the bottle while watching the Super Bowl. Looks to be clear piss gold. Bubbles can be created by swirling the bottle. Smells skunked, sour grain and bread. Tastes just awful. I don’t remember this tasting so bad when I had it before. I’ve become a cynical old codger.

Reviewed 2/27/2009 (bottle):

Pours an extremely very pale colored body, with a big white creamy head, somewhat lasting. Very malty aroma, some nuttiness. Vegetably, aroma, maybe corn. Crisp fruity, vegetably taste. Some nuttiness. Lager-like, but not as tasty as some others. Maybe corn or something. Has some taste, but not a good taste. Bleh, not good.
Pale light yellow with a small whit head. Aroma is of water and grain. Taste is of water, corn and grain.
Same as Corona Extra - except even less taste if that is possible - stick a lime in and call it a day.
Lighter than the "Extra".  Lght yellow in collor. For the Diet conscience? Add the lime!

Dude, this stuff its an exercise of low-inspiration brewing,there isnt any real reason for continue this,since its pretty realted to Modelo-Light and both are from the same company , a saltier, more metallic Corona basically,nothing more to say.
12oz bottle and can.  They really did not need a light version of corona.  Everything about it was already light.  It is the same with out the fat.

This stuff is water, therefore it could be worse. It doesn’t taste bad because it doesn’t taste at all. I could drink 20 of these and still maintain. Seriously, no exaggeration. This might actually be good for the upcoming Super Bowl; I could drink these at a good pace and still know exactly what’s going on in the 4th quarter, 5 hours into the game. Other than that, I find no reason to drink this whatsoever. It’s yellow water.
Like Corona, but less flavor.  Same yellow color, same watery palate, same offensive corny, adjunky flavor that needs a lime like a fish needs water (or Corona Light - same thing).
This is terrible.  I can give the regular one credit for being a good beach beer, but this one, when combined with a good lime, tastes like a good lime.
Bottle in Springfield, MA with Dan and Vanessa. Golden and very thin version of its namesake. Watery, skunky and not very interesting.

I didn’t think a beer existed that was worse then Bud Light. Guess what? I was wrong. This is the foulest tasting swill I have ever had. I had it many many years ago when I didn’t know any better but recently a neighbor gave me one. I hesitate to say friend anymore.

It’s carbonated water that someone farted in.  Bad-Bad-Bad

12 ounce bottle. Origin unknown. Pours Corona Golden. Crayola should totally make that a color. Aroma is light skunk and huge graininess. Taste is about like the description. 30% less calories and 30% less flavor. Starts off pure water with some grain and skunk in the finish. Why did anyone bother even making this? Why?
go for the extra.. and must have a lime, otherwise go domestic... no flavor, and very over-rated in the college world.
Bright yellow with a thin white head.  Aroma so skunky and some corn.  Taste is harsh fizzy adjunct and water and then corn.

Bottle. Clear gold with a bubbly, white head. Sharp and sweet light aroma, of hops, malt, and yeast, with a hint of citrus. Taste is quite sweet, of malt, with a hint of sharp, bitter hops. Lingering sharpness that fades almost immediately. For a crappy light beer, it is better than most crappy, light beers.

A wan straw-yellow, it pours with a minimal white head that does not hang around. Aroma was weak, and the de rigueur lime on the glass mostly masked it. Flavor was typically lagerish, malty but lacking crispness. It didn’t taste watery like most "lite" beers, but flavor was still uninspiring. Texture was not thin or watery; however, it was rather lifeless. Definitely one to pass up.
donde es flavor? i might as well just water the houseplants with it since thats all it tastes like. epic fail.
Now this stuff will curl your hair  Corona is dreadful. This is even worse.
I would rather have an Corona Extra it was not a terrible beer but not worth the corona price tag
Ah.... Corona Light I question your existance.... I will say this, the finish is remarkably clean, none of the bad taste lingers.... Big 3, if you want take a lesson from this brew....
Bottle.  A little lighter than expected.  Not too much to say about it.  Just very watered down.  Mild malts, no hops to taste.  Gotta double up on the lime.

This is corona watered down as we bought it by mistake and didn’t know it until we started playing cards.  To say the least, loser went for more beer.  This is light or clear to the pour and no head with a watery taste.
Pours a golden urine yellow. Corona watered down. Tastes like a dead skunk. Proof that advertising will sell anything!
Piss in a bottle. I dont know why they even make this stuff. Its just as bad as the regular stuff. Avoid the disapointment.

Bouteille transparente de 330 ml. La bière est de couleur blonde paille avec une effervescence à grosse bulle qui fait pétiller la bière. La mousse est modeste. Au nez on découvre des arômes de moufette et de céréales sucrées. En bouche le corps est mince avec une effervescence faible-moyenne. On goûte des saveurs métalliques avec une finale qui s’estompe en une demie seconde.
Smells like piss, and tastes very skunky.  Very light and crisp in the carb department but watered down and fake tasting in the flavor area.

Yellow in colour, with strong carbonation. Almost an exact replica of regular Corona, which makes this beer a success on at least one level. However. aromas and flavors are weak, and reek of corn, stale pale malts, and skunk. Not good at all.

Corn sweet funky nose.  Medium head, golden straw color.  Watery corn syrup, some bitterness.  Light carbonation, very thin, slight skunky finish.  This is a an exact light version of the not so great regular version.  WAY better light beers out there.
As if Corona was not watered down and flavorless enough, here comes Corona light.  Not enjoyable on any level, even with a lime.

Bottle.  Light version of a below-average beer.  Little color or head when poured.  Aroma is almost non-existent and flavor is very light.  Better to at least drink the extra version if you are going to chose one from this line.
Nothing special in this beer just the classic lager flavor, not bad not good

[1633-20080825] 330mL bottle. Smells like a cute fuzzy little skunk crawled into the brewery and curled up to sleep inside a sack of wet, rotting grains. Clear, yellow body with quick white bubbles. Tastes like that same skunk stirred some hours later and farted inside its grainy cocoon. Light body is watery. Yuck. Where’s my lime?!

(w/ jerc)

2008-08-25. Insert giant picture of a tick mark here. Sigh. Very pale yellow body with quickly fading white head. Skunky grains leap out of the glass and smack me around the face, but eventually blow off a bit, leaving behind a wasteland of diluted grainy crop residue. The flavour manages to pack a rough astringent wallop despite its feeble astringent underpinnings. One would hope that its dilute wishy washy palate would have mitigated its strength, but alas no. It manages to dig deep and offer up one last insulting poor use of malt, rough and astringent. Normally I would be eagerly passing the buck for the flaws to the ill-advised clear packaging, or the long journey to the Great White North, but to be brutally frank the skunk factor while present, is not as prominent as it by all accounts should be in the clear bottle. Instead it is the actual core nature of the beer itself that is flawed, with tragic results. Finally a beer that manages to offend me as much spiritually and conceptually as it does gastronomically. My hat is off to you Grupo Modelo; I cannot defeat you. Your kung fu is better. (The author has elected to weep quietly in the corner and will return shortly.) Bottle shamefully extracted from the LCBO, Toronto.

Wow, it’s just abhorrent. I mean how could you possibly make a worse beer? You’d have to simply brand toilet water as an ultra light beer, and you’d still have something better than this. This is the absolute pits of beer.

Ok I have no clue what Grupo Modelo (Corona) was thinking. Regular corona extra is light as it is. How is this possible? Why make beer so light and and low in alcohol to sell, just get into the bottled water market. This beer is almost clear as water. I dunno i rather drink my sink water then spend money on this.

The Best error of Modelo Group, baaaaad alcoholic drink, this is not a beer.

all the Mexican people  Open your Eyes and senses and taste a real goood beers!!! try Mineras, & Cucapas!!!

Mexican piss water.  You don’t drink this beer you rent it.  Lime or no lime it’s trash.  If you’re not supposed to drink the water when you go to Mexico why pay to export Mexican flavored water?  What a waste unless you want to get some young hotties wasted!

Bottle.  This is basically watery Corona, a beer that is already on the watery end of beers.  That said, I can see people new to drinking beer finding this a nice gateway beverage.  Slightly sweet and corny.

...bottle.  Worse, more watery, and somehow less flavor than the original.  Only people who think they are wordly drink this shit to look cool, like they care about thier body or somethin.  Waste of money.
This beer is simply just...awful. It is a crappy, watered down version of Corona, JUST like I thought it would be.

Bottle. Well what else can be said? Pours a pale yellow and that is as good as it gets. Can’t believe that I am even rating this. Tastes like water. No flavor at all not worth the price. There are so many better beers that can be drank while sitting on the beach.
I’ve often wondered what the worst beer out there is. This might be it. And for about the same price as the Stone IPA I also had tonight!
2008 Bottle - What can I say?  1/2 the grassy corn, alcohol and bitter of the original, all of the cost...what the hell?
This is poor beer.   Weakest beer I ever had 3.7%.   Terrible after taste, looks like my piss after drinking it.
bottle.  average white fizzy head with almost no lacing.  aromas of some skunk and some corn (maybe a touch of metal).  drinkable.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours a golden color with some mild carbonation and a white head.  No body, no character, hardly any taste, if any tangible taste existed, it would be a faint hint of corn.  I set my expectations abysmally low so I wouldn’t be disappointed.  There are certainly better light beers.  This is absolutely horrible and quite possibly one of the worst beers I have ever tasted.
Just got back from the shore that says it all. Not a good pick of the lot. however the lime really comes thru. No Head because it doesnt pour. It was hot and this was cold. thats the positive.
Hate to admit it but I actually bought one of these.  Why did I do that?  Unpleasant aroma  and taste of wood and adjuncts.

330 ml bottle form the LCBO breakers bin. pours very pale yellow with a fizzy white head. aroma is almost not there except the fragrance of one corn kernel.....maybe two. flavour are very light. thin, watery and fizzy. a didnt even get any skunk, it must have been fresh. not good but i wasnt expecting much.
From a bottle poured a golden color with a small amount of head.  Not much flavor, made drinkable with a lime.

Enjoyed straight out of the bottle.  Some light fruits and banana.  Lots of carbonation but pretty drinkable.  Not skunky, so I must have gotten a super fresh bottle.  I was expecting some Bud Light-like crap, but this surprised me a little.
Makes for a great radiator flush. Like others of it’s ilk this "lite" beer lives up to it’s over the top hype. My urine is stronger than this beer.

Corona with water. I shouldn’t need to say more. There is no reason to drink this. Very pale gold, with a small white head. Aroma is watery, some corn malt. Taste is watery, carbonated, slight corn malt. The only good thing is that the bitter aftertaste is only half as bad as the full strength Corona.

I gave regular Corona a good rating, but I wasn’t expecting much from this.  It didn’t seem like a good lite version of Corona was really possible.  This turned out to be accurate.  Unlike the regular, this had a weak, mediocre smell, and the label is not as appealing.  It tastes like a typical low-calorie lager.  Maybe they just took regular Corona and removed most of the malt and sugar.  Adding lime does nothing to improve the flavor.  Not terrible - just weak and dull.  There are better lite beers.

Pours watery and pale yellow. Aroma of skunk, nothing else. When it hits my mouth I’m slapped with strong carbonation, a skunky taste, very weak actual beer taste. I find myself wondering if most of the people who drink this have even even tasted a real beer. Probably not. This is basically a spoiled soft drink with alcohol content. Quite possibly the worst beer I’ve ever tasted in my entire life and way more expensive than other beers on this level of crappiness- this beer deserves the 0.5. I needed a lime just to finish this beer.
Bottle Pale and skunky the fruit notes only come in when strong additions are made.  Otherwise it goes down easier then the Extra but leaves you more sober.
it is skunky and people like it cause of name recognition only....beware.....lime masks the badness.

12 oz bottle...pours yellow w/ a diminishing white head. The nose is corn and funk. The flavor is soapy, mildly grainy, with an aspirin bitterness. Palate was watery,  thin, and the  pungent bitterness lingered around after every sip. Terrible...
Got it for free at a party.  Light yellow pee color.  Small head.  Smell is corn, malt, water.  Taste is water with some malts.  Does not get it done.
Light beer sucks, this is no exemption. Terrible it’s like regular corona with LESS flavor....lovely.

As far as I am concerned, theres no reason to drink the light of anything, ecspecially for Corona. this tones down the flavor dramatically, and doesn’t offer a whole lot for taste. Watered down. Pours a bright golden with a small off white barely noticeable head. Taste is bland. but does the trick if your concerned about the carbs.

12oz Bottle - Marco Island, Fl  

Aroma – Very light overall beer aroma. 

Appearance – Light golden color, clear as clear can get and very nice head.  

Flavor – A light beer with very little flavor perfect for the night.  (HOT Night outside) 
 
Palate – Nice Mouthfeel, good texture with a dry finish. 

Overall – A perfect hot night beer.  This was a good beer for quenching the thirst.   Funny as I look at the ost recent ratings are they rating the flavor vs the big beers or actually rating according to taste.  This beer to style is a Light Pale Lager a very average beer.
La version light de la cerveza q es mas q una mineral suave.  A una corona le ponemos hielo y sabe a esto.  Con tacos y picante buena como el agua
Not a very good light beer, tastes like fizzy water ala Keystone.  Forthe price, not a sound investment.  Put those limes to better use in a gin and tonic!!!!

Clear bottle poured a clear yellow with a small lingering white head. Aromas of straw with a hint of citrus. Palate was ligfht bodied crisp and watery. Flavors of wait... what flavor? Just water with a hint of straw and a crisp clean finish.

Aroma: Exceedingly feeble aroma; almost non-existent. I smell a bit of honey, and a bit of grass, not much more than that.

Appearance: Exceptionally clear. It actually reminds me of champagne quite a bit; pale yellowy peach in color, long streams of big bubbles rising from the bottom, virtually no head, no matter how furiously I pour.

Flavor: Not good, but not sickening, either. Kind of sweet, kind of skunky, very watery. Slight cornmeal flavor. There are some flowery hops, I think, but they are so weak they’re barely worth mentioning.

Palate: About on par with sparkling water. Each sip leaves my mouth as dry as a bone, probably a clever tactic to keep people drinking this stuff despite its lousy taste.

Overall: This is as light as a feather, so you could suck about a million of them down in an hour if you wanted to. But who the hell would want to? Blah. Actually, if it’s cold enough, this is pretty refreshing, especially with a lime in it.
its pretty good, but for me in needs a lime, a pretty typical mexican beer, probably the most popular of mexican beers.  its watered down but its also refreshing.

More flavor (ok supplemental fruit, unnatural ingredients) than bud light and coors light, plus one has the ’foreign’ name to add to the experience.  Si? No? Personally, I’d rather have bottle of something else if given the choice of a more complex beer.  Not bad on the carb count though.  Won’t refuse it if it’s free.
Corona is a great beer for a warm day or night. If think that adding lime is key to truly enjoying this beer.  The overall taste is very light and easy to enjoy.  Alright.
mild enough taste, pretty basic beer. then again it is a light beer, like everything Else "low fat", you drink to feel less guilty, same as all light beers

24 ounce bottle.  Pours a light yellow with a decent active white head that lasts.  Aroma and taste has a hint of malt.  Fairly smooth tasting and refreshing when it is cold.  Pretty much watered down Corona Extra.  Overall, it is not bad, as it is cheap, but the alcohol percentage is too low.

No reason for a Corona Light. Drink half a Corona, fill it back up with water and you’ve got Corona Light. Kind of like a diet Corona and believe me a Corona doesn’t need less flavor. Throw a lime in it and fire down tacos or fajitas and I’m sure the beer will be fine.
This is the nastiest beer that I’ve ever had in my life, it is disgusting, it is Mexican piss.
this has literally no taste. Corona is essentially a light beef. Corona light is like drinking piss yellow water.
Horrible. Piss yellow color no head or lacing. No smell at all. The taste is nothing. Don’t get this. Horrible beer.
People who drink light beer don’t like the taste of beer. They just like to pee a lot.
Smells, tastes, and looks like someone took Corona Extra (which isn’t a totally horrible beer) and watered it down 50/50 with Mexico City tap water.  Atrocious!
Well, beer like in appearance, aroma, palate, and flavor. Overall, if you are in Mexico and there is nothing else to drink other than soda, flip a coin.... if you win... get the Coke !!
bottle. pours very clear pee yellow. small white head. nose is sweet, with bread dough and malts, not very good. taste is watery and malty and salty. yuck.
It is light beer. Should be avoided at all cost - would rather drink a diet cola than try and force one of these down. Why bother at all - not even good for lawnmower beer.
This is one of the few beers on earth that can actually make me reach for a Coors light or Miller lite.  Awful.
Corona’s not even trying with this one.  It literally tastes like they added water to plain Corona.  I don’t care how hot the day is and how thirsty you are, you can do better.

Bottle. Terrible. Taste was probably due to the combination of the bottle (clear) and crappy ingredients.  Truly one of the worst beers I have ever had the misfortune of tasting.  Don’t know why there is a "light" version of Corona, but whatever.

12oz bottle.  Clear yellow with a medium sudsy soap bubbly head.  Aroma is of corn & mild hops.  Thin mouth feel and a finish that makes my face pucker like those old bitter beer face commercials.  No redeeming qualities other than I got it really cheap in a sampler pack.  Metallic, sour.  I’m pretty sure Grupo Modelo is Spanish for drain pour.

Bouteille transparente de 330ml. De couleur jaune très pâle et claire. Nez de maïs sucré (notes chimiques) avec des notes de grains de malt pâle ainsi que des notes herbeuses (gazon mouillé). Très mince en bouche avec un pétillement moyen  et très légèrement croustillant ainsi qu’une texture aqueuse. Notes de grains de malt pâle accompagné de notes chimiques lors de l’entrée en bouche suivi d’un léger goût sucré de maïs puis en finale l’on retrouve un léger goût herbeux (gazon mouillé) avec de très faibles notes amères de houblon herbeux. Post-goût très court composé de faibles notes herbeuses et chimiques.
Hahaha... ew. If the girl who was drinking this described it as "dirty armpit", it’s a failure as a light beverage. Corona "Light"... I was quite surprised this thing existed.
A weaker version of corona extra, less flavor, less body, less anything.  not to mention a weak beer in the Alc content.
this stuff is only good if you are a a sweaty landscaper in need of some cheap refreshment because you spent the rest of your money on goya products
Nice refreshing taste only on hot days, only drink with lime.  this beer is not the greatest but if you go on vacation its one of those beers you just drink....

When you have to throw a lime into a beer you know its bad.  There is practically zero head... smells like urine and looks like urine.  This MUST be cold or else its undrinkable.   No palate - less flavor then it slightly better brother - reg corona.  

In the summer I’ll have these very occasionally when its a choice between this and Coor light.

This beer flat out smells bad. Thats why you need the lime in the neck and thats why it got a 1 for aroma. drink it from the bottle don’t bother to pour it. It’s got about as much head as i have lately which is none. The beer doesn’t taste awful but when you can get a pack of miller chill for the same price go for it. Personally id rather drink the beast then this stuff.

12 oz. bottle.  Pours like dirty water with no head.  Aroma of hay and shipping boxes.  The weak flavor offers little in the way of distinguishable tastes.  Thin and watery.  This is one more in my search for bowling alley brews.

Pours with no head, pale yellow, good body for a light. Balanced hop and malt aroma. Good bitter hop flavor and a little spice. Only slighty watery. Really not a bad beer, wthout a lime. Decent carbonation. Full flavored for a light.

Can. Small fizzy white head that was quickly goon. Clear sparkling body with a pale yellow color. Light grassy feel with some hay and a hint of cardboard. Over the palate thin and light grassy. Light bodied with an average carbonation and a hint of dryness in the texture. Light bitter and sweet flavor. Thin light dry and bitter finish.
Bottle. Pale yellow, small white head. Weak sugary aroma. Weak flavor with some rather bad hops.

I will only drink this one if peer pressure dictates that I do. I have been to many nice hotel bars in Chicago/St Louis/Kansas City and am shocked at how popular this beer and Extra are. The nice suit set likes to drink this straight from the bottle. 

The best thing about this is the "fun" and "minimalist" packaging and the smell of the lime or lemon wedge. That is it. I think lemon is better then lime with this one. But definitely add the fruit. Do anything to get this one down. Would never buy this for my home or order it with mexican food. It would evaporate next to a hot fajita plate or a chile verde plate...
almost tastes identical to Extra, but you can surely taste the "light" in it. if you’re gonna drink corona, just stick with the extra unless ur watching ur weight.
Bottle. Very skunky (hops), malty. Flavor is chalky, bitter (hops), some malt that tapers off. Watery. This is a light beer, let’s face it. I would drink this over other light beers though.

12 oz bottle poured into shaker- poured transparent very thin yellow, white head went away as soon as I turned my head, medium carbonation.  Aroma of yeast and old wheat that has been sitting around for years.  Hits the mouth very watery, can barely taste much of anything.  Woud give it a slightly higher rating, but I’m not sure if this was beer or water.
Yellow color, skunk aroma and no taste to speak of. Bad, even for a light beer.

On-tap, served in a shaker glass. The bartender at Bar Louie rolled his eyes at me when I asked for the wedge of lime to be served on the side.

L: Crystal clear, pale yellowish golden with a soapy white that quickly settled into a sudsy skim. The carbonation is quite active, steady flow of micro bubbles going from the bottom to the top of glass.

S: Funky, sulphur-like lager yeast, husky spent grain and corn, fusel alcohol and boiled vegetables. A pretty unimpressive nose.

F&T: Crisp, firm moderate body, more rounded feeling than a lot of macro light lagers. The taste is bit of a letdown, sweetly bland. Cooked corn and boiled grain, the malts are thin tasting. Again, the sulphur lager yeast, with a dash of lemon in the middle. Finishes dry, briefly lingering tastes of lemony cooked corn and soda water.

Went o.k. with the mediocre fish sandwich I had for lunch today. I have to admit, adding the wedge of lime did perk up the taste a bit, but this is a beer I will only have when I want something light with a low ABV.  Far from the better macro lagers brewed in Mexico.
Even worse than the Extra version.  Less taste, less satisfying, Papa Johns........I mean corona.

Totally over-priced.   May be the worst light beer I’ve ever had!   I’m a light beer drinker and was hoping for more.  If you want to try this beer just try a case of Red, White and Blue and send me the difference.

Bottle.  Poured piss yellow with a white scum on the top.  Aroma: skunk:  Flavour: skunk, zorille (african skunk) piss, and mule piss.  Finish: skunk piss. and tree mold.  I sent this one back.  I will never drink it again
Corona Extra is skunky swill - Corona Light is even worse. that’s about it.
Im not sure why this is so many peoples "favorite beer." its watery, skunky and musty... the bottle label seems nice...

Corona and Corona light are both pretty crappy beers but if your in Mexico and you have to choose one or the other, go with the light version. It’s not usually as "skunky" and it’s at least swallowable with a lime stuck in the bottle.
I cannot stand corona.  Everyone thinks it’s so good, but to be blunt it sucks. Tastes awful, even with the lime.  I’d take Miller Chill (and for that matter, almost anything else) over it any day.

12-25-07 bottle.  
  Watery yellow color with no head.  Smell is malty and yeasty and very, very light.  Taste is actually less metallic than the regular Corona, which is somewhat nice.  Overall, feels even more watery than the regular.  Just not very good.
3.7??? Wow that’s low.  I’ve had this many times and am not surprised.  One can seemingly drinks this for days and not get drunk.  Thumbs down.
well, just like I said about the corona extra, good beer for a hot day and cost effective, also this is good for those who are calorie conscious.
Corona has always been and forever will be crap....as well as Corona light.....I’m glad I grew out of this type of beer.
Bottle.  Kind of skunky aroma.   Crap color.  Crap taste but if it is cold enough I’ll dive in.  About the same as regular corona - actually I prefer it over the two.

Skunky aroma that lingers.  Grainy malt character beneath.  Brilliantly clear golden body.  Large bubbled, fizzy, white, fully diminishing head.  Slight sweetness, corn and bitterness to the flavour but really carbonated mineral water has more character.  Very light, dry and watery with aggresive, prickly carbonation.  This really isn’t horrible, but it also doesn’t quite resemble anything I recognize as beer.  Bottle (BCLS on Cambie at 8th, Jun-07).
I will give it this, it tastes just like the corona extra and its a light beer, that gives it an extra point in my book.  So that totals to 1.5.
Not really sure why there’s even a market for a Corona Light, as the original is far from filling. Tolerable only with a lime, and even then, I’d sooner drink the ocean water.

I don’t get why anyone would actually pay money for this.  Who in the world ever tasted a regular Corona and said "Shoot, this is too much, make is lighter!"  I have never met a 1 for appearance, so its gets a 2 there and another deuce for overall only becuase it can theoretically get you drunk, but at 3.7% thats alot of bad beer....

330ml bottle.
Pours a thin yellow with a bubbly white head. Aroma is skunk, grass, and a little bit of malts. Watery feel, Papery taste. Starts sweet, ends almost bitter. Kind of offensive. Not enjoyable but easy drinking.
I really can’t tell the difference between this and the regular version. If you put a shot of whiskey in it at least you could get drunk.
Lightly skunky aroma. Yellow color, no head. Flavorless cardboard with a weak grainy finish. Corona isn’t great to begin with, but the light version is a waste of time.
Add lemon and serve ice cold and it is tolerable other than that I wouldn’t even attempt it.
A little worse than corona extra.  but still resembles that corona taste...none.  Load this one up with limes as well.
Since Corona Extra is already  "light", you can imagine what this is like.  I hear it’s better with lime (or is it lemon?); either way it looks and tastes (I think) like piss.
Closely resembles urine with a frothy white head.  Smells like a combination of sweat and ass.  Tastes like already chewed bubblegum and rotten lime.  Yummy.

pours clear faint yellow, no head, huge carb bubbles.  skunky aroma, light grains. tastes like seltzer water with a little light lager added.  faint corn and grain but really its all water and carbonation.  i’ve peed better beer.
not bad very pale little head needs lime to be drinkable but good beach beer
Well, this one actually tasted better than regular corona to me.  Still needed the lime and a lot of courage to finish this one.
Bottle: Clear gold, piss color, no head.   Skunky aroma.  Skunky flavor.  Crisp aftertaste, not my thang.  Sick.
Bottle:  Not as good as Corona.  to light and watery.  had a bit of an unpleasant aftertaste.  Needed the lime to drink it.
Even worse than regualr corona.  I don’t know why I drank this.  I wish I hadn’t.  Or maybe it was to boost my RB score?

Bottle, at a lame party. They didn’t have any limes so I just drank the thing straight from the bottle and in a hurry. If I were at home I’d pour it out but desperate times called for desperate measures. It is thankfully more watery tasting than regular corona so not having a lime around to cover the foul taste didn’t hurt as bad. The bottles are kind of nice though, thick and painted.

9/22/2007:  Corona Light is a few shades lighter in color than Corona Extra and pretty much tastes the same.  Actually, it’s hard to believe, but Corona Light might even be slightly more grainy, grassy, sour, and skunky than Corona Extra!  Needless to say, this beer is extremely light and is really only palatable with copious amounts of lemon and lime in it.  If I had to pick a Mexican beer to drink, then I’d take a Sol or anything else over this beer any day!



12 fl. oz. bottle at friend’s house during the 3rd Annual Poker Party.  Thanks Ryan!  Rating #452 for this beer...

Come on. The very identity of this beer is defined by using a fruit (lime) with a strong flavor as an independently introduced adjunct in order to give the beer some flavor. That right there appeals to ones logic and begs you to think this is awful.
Gross. Worse than regular corona.  Avoid.  There is nothing good about this beer. I dont know why everyone raves about corona.  Its garbage.

Had this thing on 3/27/2001.  Color seems to be darker then Corona Extra.  Aroma is just bad it smells like a skunk farted in my glass.  Taste is just as bad as the aroma and it may be one of the worst beers I ever had.
Even worse than Corona Extra, this beer remins me of what you get when you give a horse diaretics.
The worst light beer ever! Yes this beer has taste but the taste is very awful and it is hard to drink.
Ridiculously light and offensive in every category.  Skunky and reprehensible.
Horrible taste, smell, look, and feel.  There isnt much i like about this beer. But living in florida by the beach, i am forced to have to watch people drink it.  Awful.

I generally dislike light beers but this one has become my favorite.  It has fewer objectionable qualities than a typical macro-brewed beer.  Compared to Miller lite, which is my second fav. light beer, this one is MUCH lighter.  Drinking it is a lot like drinking water...significantly lower alcohol content...not much flavor or texture but it’s perfectly drinkable.  I’ll choose this one over any other light beer.
Not much difference between this and the regular stuff....maybe a little less brewer’s rice or corn or whatever other additive.
12oz bottle, 24oz bottle.  Read my review of Corona Extra, pretty much the same applies to this beer.  Moreover, the alcohol content makes me want to cry.  I will never get this again.

Ok..in my opinion this is a pretty decent beer. I’m probably some what of a victim of the excellent marketing by Corona but I think this is actually a pretty good beer on a hot summers day. I love to drink this beer by the pool or after a day at the beach. It doesn’t have the best flavor but it’s thirst quenching and goes down easy. 

Always drink this out of the bottle. If poured into a glass it loses it’s....pazazz. Don’t buy it if your looking for something flavorful with your meal.
Pretty much the same review i gave corona extra..... only this beer is a little lighter!
The single worst beer I can think of, right at this moment.  I would drink a cranberry & gasoline before this.  Avoid at all costs.
a light version of something that already doesnt taste like anything? This isnt beer! this gets a .5 simply out of principle.
i would like to give a lower score but it is not possible. i would not waste the lime to put in it. smells and tastes very skunky.
Foul, just plain foul. Tastes about like water mixed with corn syrup. Aromas are of rotten vegetables. Sickly sweet taste. Nasty to the max. Seek out beer beer gang.
Watery, light, slightly bitter - only good with a lime and when there are no other reasonable options.
I’m not even sure I can call this a beer.  Almost no color or head to speak of.  I am not sure where people are getting an aroma.  I guess my nose just isn’t up to the task.
a little bitter, light struck, I think. Flavor is up front, followed by thinness - watery. Maybe ok if you’re a beached whale.
i guess there is some hop flavor...maybe? I drank this while listening to a really strange conversation with awkward people.

Bottle. Aroma of grassy hop. Light golden color and a decent white head. Thin to medium bodied. Moderate carbonation. Some small amount of malt and enough grassy hop to notice. About like Bud, except I don’t detect adjuncts.
a tasteless beer, better by the the lime. BUt, kinda wish I hadn’t tried it...
Bottle... I guess the easiest way to put it is that I have yet to like a pale lager.

I’m maybe 90% positive that this is actually beer.  However, call me nuts but there is something about sitting along the pool in 95 degree weather drinking one that makes it taste a bit better.  Normally, I’m anti-"fruit your beer" but the lime helps  (i heard somewhere the lime in mexican beer thing is total marketing spin).  Oh well.  Drink one.

Pours a very clear and light straw with a thin white head consisting of large, almost-soapy bubbles. The aroma is primarily lager yeast, but is followed by a subtle whiff of bitter hops. The flavor begins very plain and heavily-carbonated. It is difficult to detect flavor over the carbonation sting. The middle of the tongue detects some grassy hops notes and some sweet corn. The finish is very dry and short. The mouthfeel is very light and thin, though heavily bubbled with carbon dioxide. Overall, it is far inferior to its non-lite version. Normal Corona is not a great beer but drinkable - especially on a hot day. This beer is far less palatable.

Aroma is light sweet malt and citrus (not from hops); some caramel.  Beer is a light yellw with non existant white head; totally clear. Flavor is sweet malt forward with light citrus flavors and light bittering.  Clean, corny and slightly grainy.  Mouthfeel has a very light carb texture, clean finish and a very faint graininess. Overall, I think I prefer this to Corona Extra. It’s a bit sweeter with a cleaner finish.  If the goal is to cool you down and drink fast, this is a little bit better choice.
xxx I hate corona, it tastes like grass that my dog peed on (or so I can imagine, never tasted that)

330 ml bottle. Pale yellow colour with a fully diminishing fizzy white head. Mostly absent aroma with a faint banana ester. Same flavour profile - mostly non-existent but a light banana flavour. Light bodied, fizzy mouthfeel. The light banana and lack of corn made this better than Corona for me. But still not very good.
its an ok beer it needs more alcohol in it 3.7 wtf its a good tasting lihght beer

Bottle. Drank in Las Vegas. golden clear colol, no arom and refreshing flavor no more else, good to hot days like desert :).

Cerveja clara, sem aroma, sabor refrescante e boa para dias quente de verão, nada mais!
In the tradition of low calorie mass market pale lagers this beer really has nothing special about it other that a watery taste in comparison to the regular version.
Nothing special to note here. Not much taste or body.  Typical macro colour and aroma.  Lackluster, nothing to say that hasn’t been said already.

Basically baby Corona, which means it has even less of the nearly non-existant redeeming qualities that it’s big brother has.  Thin, watery, pale, and golden, it looks the part of a lousy pale lager.  Tastes skunky, corny, and grainy.  Drinkable as a water substitute on the hottest Florida beachside day.  On second though......nah....I’d probably just opt for the water.
Pours a light pale yellow with a white head. Dry grainy aroma with some faint hops. Flavor is similar to aroma with a repulsive tart finish.
Water. Food Coloring. Added Carbonation. A small hoppy presence. Water. This is a beer? I would rather have water. Or a Budweiser product.
Stale piss water.  Probably the worst beer I’ve ever had.  And you thought Corona was bad!!!!

Cold 12oz bottle:  Pours a clear very pale yellow color with a moderate fizzy alabaster head that is quickly diminished.  Aroma is of light skunk, light grains and grass.  Taste is of light grains, light citrus and grass.  Extremely watery.  It’s like tap water with a twist of corn and citrus.

Bottle:  Very light pale yellow with a white head that quickly fizzes away, smells like plastic and earth with some skunk and tastes that way too.  Watery and very fizzy with a carbonation burn on the way down.  A sad waste of water, but luckily hardly any malts or hops were destroyed in making this beer.
TAstes like nothing, probbly les bad than Corona Extra but still being a senseless beer. At least I got it.

I was invited to a friend’s college graduation party with a greeting catch phrase, "Welcome! We have good beer here." Great, I visited the beverage center to find two beers. Corona and Diet Corona. "Right!" I said to myself in a John Cleese British accent. Diet Corona pours an urine golden yellow color with a small white head. Urrr, it was there a moment ago. Now it’s gone. Aroma is light popcorn, some enriched Wonder bread, and an aged road kill skonk after I drove past it three miles ago. Taste is a lilttle citrus and corn. Fnish is very watery and gritty. "Brewed with the highest quality ingredients?" What kind of ingredients I ask. It’s amazing how so many beer drinkers are brain-washed to even think this is beer.
I think this is a little better then the full strength, but obviously not saying much. No aroma, looks like piss, but not too terrible with the lime and a couple of tacos.

Bottle.  I didn’t bother decanting.  This beer is a golden pale urine yellow and makes huge detergent-like bubbles as you swig.  There is a faint hop aroma, nothing offensive.  The flavor is marked by overcarbonation, faint hop bitterness, and lots of nice corn ajunctness if there is such a word.  Slightly salty and rather bland, but not terrible.

Drank out of the bottle (does anyone pour this into a glass?). Obviously didnt put enough lime in this one. This tasted much worse than any corona I’ve ever had. But thats probably because its ’light.’  Was at my house for a college graduation party for my cousin, and my gramps and two uncles both grabbed these, so i decided to have one too in solidarity. Big mistake. I even had half a grolwer of Selin’s Grove Phoenix the Kriek in the fridge which my aunt really loved when we tried some later. My uncles didnt seem too interested in my beer/brewing aspirations.   Anyway, corona light sucks. 

Re-rate: Never thought I would do this, but I am re-rating Corona Light. Had another bottle with the same uncles as last night and it was quite refreshing on a hot summers day. Not tasty (by craft beer standards), but far better than the swill I have rated above this.
33 cl bottle, Fargo. What can you say. Stick a lime in it and drink a lot of ’em. (it got a 4 on flavor cuz I like lime a lot).

Yes its one of the most watered down beers in the world, but its supposed to be. Its for teenagers and girls who want to drink a lot of beer easily. I use to when i was in high school. Now i know what real beer is and this light corn colored, watered down extra light, light beer is nota real beer. But it doesn’t pretend to be.

Drank on Cinco De Mayo right out of the bottle with a lime.  At the in-laws house, it was either this or Coors Light.  I guess that I could have had milk or water instead.  This could possibly be the most watered down beer in the world.  There is absolutely no taste that resembles beer.
Why do I go out of my way to try these beers.  It was bland and light and offered nothing....to boot the aromas was skunky!
Bottled. Pours light yellow in color. Light grainy aroma. Maybe a hint of malt. Fairly bland flavors. Kind of like mineral water with a light beer flavor. Not offensive, just boring.
A light version of a light lager.  Nothing I would go out of my way to hit up.

12 oz. bottle- color of straw yellow , with a minimal white head – faint nose of skunk , bubblegum , yellow sweet corn , slight oatie-ness , and metallic – taste of lime zest (the bad kind) , watery , sweet corn , and sour funk - body is watery , acidic , abrasive , and with medium carbonation– aftertaste of abrasive lime peel , and a horrible bitterness
Bottle. Pale golden beer with a quickly disapating white head. Sweet, grainy aroma. Mineral, sweet grain flavor. LIngering mineral notes. Medium body. Just bad.
Yuck! Picked this up by mistake and figured it couldnt be that bad once i brought home.....strongly mistaken! Taste like carbonated water.....horrible!

(Bottle 35,5 cl) Clear, pale golden with a white head. Sweetish aroma of corn and a whiff of hops.Thin-bodied and watery, notes primarily being brewing cereal and nothing much more. A touch of hops in the finish, a wee wee touch. 220307

This beer is in a clear 12 oz bottle.  From the outside, I can tell it is the color of your typical pale yellow american lager.  When you pour this into your glass, it has but a white froth for a head.  It is interesting to note that it has medium large and small streaming bubbles rising from within the brew.  In other brews, I always observe the bubbles that stream are usually the same size. When you pop the cap, I immediately noticed an aroma of skunk cabbage. This seems to overwhelm any yeasty beer smells that may be present. Upon tasting, you get the average lager expectations, nothing real offensive. Flavor is not really too bad. I think I do detect some citrus peel bitterness in the background. Not as light tasting as I would have expected after reading some of these reviews. It does have a good moderate lager presence for a light brew. On par with its Corona Extra father as far as flavor goes. Slight low bitter interesting linger on the finish. Overall, just your same old ubiquitous pale yellow american lager.  Schmidt’s is much better than this.
I thought Corona was bad but then they added water to creat this crap. hate it, waste of my money, never again.
My lowest rated beer so far. Zero pleasurable flavor. A hint of somthing gone rotten and that about it. The price is an insult to anybody but those most trend infatuated.
Beer has no real character or taste, extremely watered down with strange aftertaste. Good for marinating carne asada though.
Clear pale yellow body with a small white head. Dry grainy aroma with some light honey. Sweet honey flavor with a dry grainy background.
Bottle. Pale yellow with a short bubbly head. Very weak aroma. Thin maltish flavour. Closer to water than beer.
As far as light beer goes, I’d take this over a bud or coors light.  But it’s not great.  The lime helps... A lot!
Bottle-Memphis. Looks and tastes a lot like Extra but thinner or "lighter" (what a concept!). However, does not taste like Extra with extra water.

same with what i said about the regular corona. if you need fruit in a beer to make it taste better especially the watered down light version forget about it! better than some light drain pours but i will pass.
Bottle.  Kind of like the original Corona if you watered it down and put it in a bottle with a different label.  Oh wait...
Everything I despise about Corona and less.  If only the rumors about it were true, this would be a more flavorful and interesting product.

Well, during the holidays sometimes you have to be polite and drink what is offered to you at a party. Rotting vegetable aroma. Corn syrup water, with some strange metallic qualities, and vacant of anything that would imply beer.
Not a good beer, Re-phrase, NOT good water, the best thing about this beer is the lime they put in it, by itself it is horrible.....

I was fairly unimpressed with this beer, and I am really not that hard to please. Drank from bottle with the lime because bartender forgot to bring me a glass as requested...Worst light beer I have had to date...
Bottle. Clear light head with skunky smell. Just like Corona slightly more watered down.

Bottle.  Without a lime so I could actually taste the beer.  The marketing team for Corona are geniuses because this beer is not that great.  Anyways, tastes like a watered down Corona, just as I thought it would.  I had one because it was he only beer at the beach barbeque that I hadn’t already sampled yet.
Bottle. Didn’t think this beer could get any worse but it can. Even with a lime in it.
Not much different from regular corona, clear yellow color, very wattery, a slight step up from a lot of cheap american beers, but that doesn’t say a lot.
Very similar to Corona Extra, maybe slightly more watery.  Even ice cold out of the bottle this is barely drinkable.  Very skunky.
Just like Corona Extra, this one falls far down the list as well.  Still tates a little bit skunky to me.

I bet in blind taste test this beer would be all over the board...go with me here, This beer has been really good at times (for a light) and (at the beach)...but when you really sit down and analyze what you got in your hand,the flavor just falls short, even for a light beer....good bitters though..

thanks dallas, had good times with this back in high school..

Clear light gold with thin white head. Sweet malt and slightly skunky yeast aroma. Light flavor of sweet malts, some light crisp hops and a bit of corn flakes. Not too hateful. A big step up from the macro swill.
A nasty version of Corona Extra, which is itself not a good tasting brew at all.  When I drink this, I think of drinking Mexican piss.
very slightly MAYBe better than miller lite maybe SHITTY taste horrible beer mexicans can keep this piss
Worst beer, not flavor. Not a good buy. Taste of water, its just better to drink some tap water than this.
12oz bottle-A light golden color with a small white ring of a head. Taste of water and light corn. Not much taste.

Bottle.  Clear straw color, white head.  Aroma is dominated by skunkiness.  Very light body.  Flavor is dry, skunky, carbonic from high carbonation.  Bitter finish.  Overall, add a lime and I can manage a few of these on vacation.  No lime and actually thinking about the flavor makes it hard to stomach.
good. better with a lime, but good. worthy of my purchase. i don’t consider this a mexican brew.
I bought that because I had to drive but wanted to drink some beers. I drank 4 and felt just five for driving. It got no quality as a beer, but take it for what it is.

Pale Lager is an understatement for this. this more like Pale^5 Lager. With an unpleasnt taste of everything. Its water down swill. There are some people who think that this is decent beer. Glady, I’m not one of them

Bottle at a pool party in Phoenix (118 F). Even though the heat was excruciating and you should think that this beer would be refreshing... Well... No. Totally flavourless. People who like this probably doesn’t like beer at all.

Bottled, pasteurised. Pale yellow with fizzed head. No lime in this baby. Definite corn flavour, I get that but little else, sweetish late on, I’m struggling for description because it is basically tasteless. Quick get a slice of lime please.
12 oz bottle. Pours a pale yellwo with a white head. Very faint aroma of sweet grain. Flavor is also a bit on the sweet side. I actually found that I preferred Corona Light to regular Corona.
It had a ligth taste (almost no taste) I prefer the real corona. To stop thirst it is ok since it taste like water.
Corona light....could it get any worse. Woooo, watered down Corona! Total garbage. Why would anyone ever drink this crap.
12 oz bottle-pours a white head, color is yellow/pale gold.  Aroma is sweet grain.  Taste is light, refreshing grain taste.  Good carbonation.

12 oz bottle. I tried the corona light side by side with corona extra and couldn’t really discern much of a difference. The light had almost no aroma. Clear golden color with thin bubbly white head that didn’t lace the glass. I made sure to ask the waitress to leave out the lime. It had an alomst nonexistent aroma and flavor with a touch of grainy malt. Very uninspiring. I’ll leave the lime in if I ever have to have this beer again.

Had 2 bottles of this last night at a grubbin BBQ. I’ve had this before but i revisited it to refresh my memory before i posted. Looks liek piss in a bottle and smells like a cheap beer. Flavor is plain and dosed with alcohol and really made my my mouth dry and stink. I hate Coronas not even a lime could of saved this.
Wow. Water of waters. No taste, very little smell, no mouthfeel, and worst of all no alcohol. What a waste of money.
Golden amber with white bubbly head. Smell is a sweet skunky aroma. Bitter sour leaves the mouth dry and lemony.
grabbed one after golf, might as well have had a water.  this is one of the worst i’ve had.  not even going to waste my time writing about it.
All has been said about this beer. It takes a lot of guts to charge a premium for this beer !!!!
Bottle: Another absolutley horrid beer.  Tastes like seltzer water to me.  Carbonated water with some bitter flavor, end of story.
A low calorie beverage that may get you intoxicated. Watery... definately drink with a lime (or two).
I ask you, Grupo Modelo, why?  Why brew an even weaker version of your famous beer?  Less flavor, less aroma, less alcohol.  This beer sucks.

A bad beer. Very watery light body. Dull grain flavor with yeast of leather and metal. Very light bad hops. Off taste in finish. Just avoid this. Not the worst, but another from which you can see the bottom of the ladder.
Its like regular corona plus water. Bitter taste and almost no head. Very weak beer.

Bottle. Aroma and appearance are duplicate of that of regular Corona. Flavor is alot more watery that regular Corona, and the carbonation seems slightly less. Flavor is slightly hoppy. Nothing special, just seems like a watered-down version of the regular stuff. If you want an idea of the flavor, just check the ratings for regular Corona and water it down alot.
drinks diet like a soda.  only good for hot days.  without a lime it would be unbearable

Pours pale pale yellow with minimal white fizzy head.  Aroma is grassy and metallic.  Flavor is water and tin, actually a lot more watery and flat than the original.  I like the normal stuff for the beach, this stuff just blows.
Horrible watered down corona, even the color looked liked it was recycled. BLAH

Not bad bad, but not great. Could be called just plain old "bad." Better than some other macro light beers out there, but certainly not something I’d ever order again with my own cash. Pale yellow/golden color. Some adjuncts detectable with some Mexican funk going on. Not skunky, though.
It’s great when you drop in a slice of lime, serve with chips & salsa, and the thermometer is high.  Other than that, kind of bland.
Bland yes, but I like it espeacially on hot days, I’d stay with the original though, this is watery and not as citusy.
Like I said about the Extra...great on a hot day...light mouth feel is crisp with a touch of light citrus. Goes down easy.

I really feel like however crappy you think Corona is, this does an exceptional job of matching the feel and flavour of the beer while maintaining the light characteristics.  It maybe isn’t that great of a beer, but it sure is a good match to the original.

Bouteille claire de 12 oz. Arôme: Odeur de moufette. Apparence: La couleur est blonde avec une moyenne densité de bulle. Absence de col et de dentelle sur le verre. Saveur: Goût de foin (?). Courte durée de l’arrière goût. Palette: Le corps et la texture sont mince. Moyenne effervescence en bouche. Légère amertume en arrière goût. (Rating #467)
Beer should not be in a clear bottle, nor should it be clear itself.  Not worth it, there are better light beers out there. avoid!
Again, why would I try a light pale lager made in Mexico? Because it is offered as one of the many free beer choices in my resort. As bland as you would expect.

Pale yellow hue, pours with a brief white head, with a skunky smell at the opening of the bottle, light floral hops and hay notes in the aroma follows through on a light-bodied palate with a light sweet pale malt accent, faint straw flavor, leading towards a shy zesty and very light hoppy finish.
how to make this beer:  take a large pitcher, pee in it, add sugar and hops and set in the sun for a few weeks.  Enjoy!
Eh, what do you expect?  It tastes like it looks.  Just like the regular corona, and nothing spectacular to say the least.
Skunky water very light pee yellow, no malt flavor like its regular counterpart. no hops no real nothin, better that bud lite but not much

I happened to have one of these left over from some friends that visited. Most of it went into a chili that I was cooking, but I decided to go ahead and rate it as well. Clear yellow color with a small white fizzy head. Aroma is not plesant, skunky. Flavor is about the same as regular corona, bland and watery. no wonder people stick limes in this crap.... bleckh!!

bottle - Corn!  Oh what a surprise, it’s a fizzy, yellow, watery pale lager.  How original.  Granted I have definitely had worse.  If you’ve had most of the bestselling beers in America, you already know what it tastes like anyway.  I’m really just whoring for a rating.  Sadly I actually drank one tonight though.

Every Corona that I have ever had the misfortune of drinking was terrible. I used to think that I was just unlucky and got skunked ones. Then I realized that *all* Corona tastes and smells skunked. Awful.

The appearance is a pale gold with almost no head. The aroma is corn malt and a little trashy. The flavor is much the same with a light but astringent bitterness in the finish. This definitely needs a lime.

had this at my brother in laws house last night....left over from some party.   smelled a bit skunky , big surprise its in a clear flippn bottle, tasted coronaish, i guess, never had one without a lime.  actually seeemed a bit more thin with a tangy aftertaste that sticks to the soft palate. alright i’m a bitch because i used it for a rate.
I had about 15 of these at a wedding once.  That’s about all I can remember.

Why water down a beer that was already watery to begin with?  This one has no redeeming qualities about it.  About the best I can say is that it’s inoffensive but that’s because it tastes like seltzer with a splash of citrus.

Is there anything worse than Corona, I asked myself while writing this rating?  No.  The only redeeming quality of this beer is the fact that it is even less hoppy than its "heavier" brother and so the aroma is something slightly less than the freshly-killed skunk aromas wafting from a regular Corona (perhaps, merely, live-pissed-off-skunk on the Corona light).  Alas, it suffers an appearance hit vs. Corona as it is just too watery to look attractively golden and so ties with its heavyweight counterpart for my vote of worst-beer-rated.

Funny, after two years of living in Mexico, I had never seen this beer...  Less than a month after returning the the U.S., there it was.  Well, it had no aroma to speak of.  The color was a pale yellow, and there was almost no head.  What there was of it, was white.  The flavor was a bland grassy, but it lacked the metallic hints normally found in a Modelo product.  The mouthfeel was light and watery.  Overall, I probably like this better than normal Corona, but I’m not going out of my way to find it.

All of the qualities which gave regular corona a rating above zero are virtually void in this. Ive only had it once and really dont see reason to ever again unless its the last drink on earth and i need it for hydration. a lime in this is necessary if youre forced to consume it-i can honestly say, good beer bias aside, this stuff just isnt good -its skunky corn juice with some seltzer-yet still beats out some bottom shelf US macro lights

Alright, I’m back to being a whore...I ordered this KNOWING FULL WELL that it was awful, because I needed the rating!  Are you happy now, Joe? Now you see that you’ve dragged me down to your level.  Skunky/funky/corn/but thank god it’s watery. At least  piss water,  I imagine,  tastes like piss!
Light yellow color.  Smells and taste of skunk.  Watery and a little bitter in a bad way.  Potent after taste and very thin.  This beer is popular yet troubleing to me.

Bottle. Pours light yellow, clear enough to read through (I tried it) and a fast fading soapy white head. The aroma is as if one stuffed a skunk in a corn husk and tried to cover the smell with Lysol. The flavor is even worse. A veritable TON of cleaning chemicals. With no exaggeration at all, this actually tastes troublingly toxic. A weird sort of chemical burn lingers in the back of the throat for several minutes after sipping. An unpleasant experience all around. STAY AWAY!

bottle. Are you kidding me? What is this? Plenty of skunk, yet the corn still shines through somehow. This is clear. Really clear. no head. I did not think this could get any worse, then I took a sip. Holy crap. This doesn’t even begin to taste like beer. It’s pretty much corn mash with a few cleaning products and tons of water.  This is absolutely punishing.

If I could give this beere a 0.0 I would. I don’t see how anyone who enjoys drinking beer would give this beer anything more than a zero. Without the mask of taste bud numbness and a big squeeze of lime, this beer, literally could make a maggot gag. Disgusting. An insult to the brewing industry. This Mexican piss, not even fit for peons,  does not deserve to be called beer. What does this beer taste like? Regular Corona after its passed though your bladder.

Hey I’m on the site and drinking one as I type so ... Well I’m thirsty & don’t want soda or coffee.  I’m doing some work so I’ll save the my good stuff for later.  This is my friend’s.  May have to X them after this stuff.  :-)  Not really beer.  Right?  Let’s call it a straw color, slightly sour seltzer.

Pours very pale yellow with a fully receding white head. Aroma of corn, DMS, and souring grains. Taste is corn, metallic, grainy. Mouthfeel is watery and highly carbonated. So bad that it’s not even refreshing. I keep getting shocked by how bad this is. To the sewers.

The first thing that hit me after I removed the lime the bartender put in the neck was a skunked odor. I  asked a fellow patron who was drinking this if hw thought mine smelled bad. He said no it was just like his. I made it through a third of the bottle and gave up. The color was a weak yellow, it smelled skunked and it tasted bad.
Bottle.  Poor.  102% Skunkyness.  Just awful.  What are these people thinking?
i drank one of these by accident...it was par i guess,but i certainly wouldnt have it again.  why they even make light of this i dont know

Pours with little white head. A funky, acidic smell becomes a funky, acidic taste. Heavy carbonation gives acerbic bite which makes up for complete lack of taste otherwise. Watery and funky. Should be served nearly frozen.

A good light beer for a cookout,  a  party, or a summer day @ the beach. Don’t bother to pour it,  just fill the cooler & get the bottles ice cold. The lime gives it the citrus flavor it needs to go down easy, kind of bitter without it. A nice fun change of pace beer, but nothing special tastewise. Smoother than Corona Extra.

Corn and grassy aroma, hops are to faint to smell without tasting, even so, the hops are few and no bitterness. The color and body of CL suffer compared to Corona Extra. There is no swirl in the pour and this is less carbonated. Tastes almost the same, but a tad more thin. Easy finish. Better enjoyed a little sweaty, not super-ice cold. The lime helps, but turns the beer completely flat, unlike Modello or Corona Extra. Better than the usual macro lights for sure.

Pours a mellow golden yellow color.  Aromas of grains, light hops, and a funky musty smell.  Flavor is bland with a weird funk, add a lime to it to kill the funky taste and it is almost drinkable.  This is probably the worst mexican lager on the market.  Why drink this when you can get Pacifico, Modelo, Tecate, or Dos Equis.

A decent light beer, but came out of the bottle rather skunky in both smell and flavor.  The best description I can give is a light beer than has given a valiant effort to tasting like its full relative, but come up a little short.

You know how sometimes you have those flavored fruit drinks that taste like water with a piece of fruit run through it?  This beer is a perfect example of what water would taste like with a beer run through it.

That’s probably why they serve it with a lime.
What is light about a beer thats regular not much more than water????
this is basicly flavor water light all i can taste is water maybe that is why people put limes in it toadd some much needed flavor

Bottle (330ml - clear).  Opened it - huge miasma of skunk. Poured oily clear flat light yellow with an average foamy head.  Aroma of harsh, crappy, skunk and crap crap crap probably the worst beer I’ve ever smelled.  Taste is skunky, yes, but there’s almost beer in there - sharply fizzy, vaguely hoppy, light body.  Jesus this is bad stuff.
Bottle at local pub during UC football game. What you have to do to rate a beer. Enjoyed biting into lime afterwards to clear my mouth.
Did I really think there was benefit in drinking this? Same as corona extra only lighter and less body.
Bottle. Piss yellow with a textbook ring of bubbles. Nose is all dust and corn. Taste-skunk, pilsner malt, cardboard. Aftertaste of sweet malts and carbboard. Water mand malt. That’s it.
Just another weak ass beer, just like a regular corona, a customer gave me this no way would I pay for it.

What the hell is wrong with you people?  This is my drink of choice at any and all Mexican restaraunts when I don’t get a margarita or they are out of Pacifico.  Top with lime wedge and you are in below-the-border heaven.
haha....god....just don’t drink it. Get yourself some los modelo or something. This is literally swill. however it does contain alcohol.....so I am almost ready to just call it a wash.

Hmmm...  Bottle....  Uhmm...  This beer has left me tripping on my words.. about its only redeaming quality was it quenched my thirst.  But then again so would have Gatorade or Water.  Very watery, very little if No flavor.  Uhmm... thats all I can really stand to say about it.

The only available beer at a recent gathering.  This really didn’t do the job, which is sad, because so many other mediocre beers would have sufficed.  As expected, it was watery and lacking in flavor.  Just a hint of malt.  For as unappealing as it was, I do appreciate the fact that it’s a good beer to drink if you need to drive anywhere--at 3.7%, you really would have a tough time getting drunk off of the stuff.
Lighter in flavor and alcohol content than the Extra.  Refreshing, like water.  Add a lime for limeade.
The best light beer that I’ve tried, but what does that really say? Tastes a bit like Corona, which is surprising for a light version of a brew. Rather boring.
A watered down version of a beer that was pretty watered down to begin with.

bottle. golden straw colour with a short lasting small white head. aroma is simply awful, full of vile corn and plastic. why they have to make a light version of the already poor Corona, I will never know. the body is thin and watery with plastic taste. putrid swill.

This is not a good beer.  People who think Cancun is a trip to Mexico, think this and it’s original are good beers.  Watered down.  I would like to see the ingredient listing used to brew this.  It probably consists of water, some yeast, some hops.  I gave a recipe in my Corona regular review.  Use it for this turd of a beer also.

Bottle, Rogers Cup tennis tournament, Toronto. Frothy white head, pale yellow.  Not much aroma t all.  Same with taste - there almost no flavour to speak of, certainly watery and frothy as well.  No offensive tastes as well I suppose.  It does make the regular Corona seem pretty flavourful though.
One good thing is that it really does taste similar to the original Corona.  So I am staying skinny tonight.
Wow....and you think coors light is watered down?  This is nearly water..and with very low alc %
what can i say for a light beer  corona has it.  even  with lime it’s an easy beer nice weekender.

Bottle: I lived for 4 years in Mexico and couldn’t find this one anywhere, I finally got my hands on one in Florida on vacation. Golden yellow, medium white frothy head. Aroma is surprisingly good, hops, and a bit herbal. Taste is actually OK for light beer especially coming form Corona.

In my opinion this is superior to Corona extra. It basically is tasteless. It’s light golden with no depth. There is no aroma. There is really nothing. Since I find normal Corona offensive, this is better. 30% less calories, and by complete ’chance’ this one also has about 30% less alcohol. The marketing at Corona is fantastic.
did not enjoy this, very watery, pour golden with no head, lack luster appearance and smell, not much anything for body.

Sparkling gold body, little to no head. Aromas consist of wet cardboard, corn, alcohol, chemicals. taste is sharp metals, corn, chemicals. Skunked all the way. Not good. Probably better with lime, but no more por favor!

330ml clear bottle. Upon popping the cap I was greeted with a rush of horrible skunk and corn stink. Extra pale yellow, white head fizzes away in about 2 seconds. Flavours of club soda and corn, a bit metallic as well. Papery aftertaste.

God allmighty!! if I wasn’t after the rating I wouldn’t even have bought this!
Drain pour!
All corn and ....Colt 45 was better!

Great mother of god this is a horrible beer! Sampled from a 12 oz clear bottle this "beer" poured a medium golden color with a small white head. The aroma is pungent with skunk. The flavor is nothing but skunk. Disgusting!

Bottled, in the back of a pimped up limo, travelling from JFK to down town NYC.  Possibly the best worst beer rated EVER. This beer was horrible and not worthy of mention, but the mood, the atmosphere, the filthy dirty flashing neon lights running 25ft down the inside of the beast made for a priceless moment. With man Soloman at the wheel and this bottle of Corona Light in my hand, I had this city at my mercy.

Corona is bad enough why make it light??  Pours yellow with a white frothy head that dissipates quickly.  Aroma is really not favorable.  It doesn’t have much and what it does stinks.  The flavor is pretty flavorless too.  Only buy this if you plan to wash down tacos.  Other than that it is pretty bad.  I’m glad I don’t go to Mexican parties every weekend.

Pretty much exactly the same as Corona Extra. Glad I bought a second lime.


Kenwood Liquors, Oak Lawn, IL

I’m working on my truck tonight.  I’m in my old, ripped up jeans and an old T-shirt and my hands are covered in black grease with some touches of blood mixed in.  It is pretty hot outside for an April day in Wisconsin.  I’m pretty thirsty and decide I want a beer.  Now I’ve had this Corona light cellared for over a month now just waiting for the perfect moment.   I threw the beer in the freezer to get it up to the appropriate serving temperature.  A little while later I’m at a stopping point on the truck and I need to consult the manual.  Time to break open the Corona.  No need to pour it because I can enjoy the appearance right through the clear bottle.  Nice pale yellow color, it compliments the blue label very nicely.  I drink this straight from the bottle and I get mostly aromas of earthy grease from my hands, which makes the beer taste not too bad.  I knew I would like this better than Corona Extra because it was bound to have less flavor.  It is light and refreshing, hitting the spot and making me feel more like a normal beer drinkin’, truck drivin’ Wisconsinite.
Just plain nasty.  I don’t know how they can make a beer with so little flavor so awful.
I just dont like this beer, it is insipid, and nasty, I dont reccomend this to anyone.
Still Metallic in flavor just like Extra.  Have to drink this one with a lime too.  Don’t waste your money.

If you didn’t have the lime to add the citrus does this beer even have an aroma. Maybe because of the pollin in the air and the nose isn’t the best that maybe the case. Bland and just can’t figure out why people say this is a good beer.
I had this during spring brek because they ran out of regular... not bad had it with a lime and salt has a little skunked smell and taste to it but not that bad
This was about the same as Corona.  I have to drink it with a lime.  Not horrible.  Good for a hot day.  That’s about it.
a terrible light beer. has a worse taste than the beast and that is saying a lot this is def a beer that never should have been made into a light.

This beer tastes like it already has a lime in it and i just opened it. I dont like it at all i just done like mexican beers. This beer has no aroma that i can dectect it is sofar the worst beer that i have had

Clear bottle from a country that has a lot of sunlight?  They must be relying on turnover.  Urine-yellow color, some white fizziness suggesting a cola drink.  Moderately skunky aroma with sweet notes.  Easy drinking at first, mildly watery flavor with more skunkiness.  Carbonation isn’t there at all...it washes down like water, leaving a light metallic twinge that builds and gets really annoying.  Perhaps I shouldn’t be surprised at how watery this is--it is "light" beer after all, but this is rather watery!

Bottled. This is almost going against the grain to say this sample wasn’t as terrible as I thought it’d be. Admittedly there’s not much flavor, but I had an almost decent hoppy aroma that could have been skunkiness. Still, no real malt taste to speak of. But I could let this one in and say there was a bitterness. Some. I was a guest, so I didn’t turn it down.

This is pretty freaking bad.  It is much worse then regular Corona.  Corona is refreshing this is depressing.  I’m working on my poetry skills.  It tastes like bad water with a little squezzed lemon.  Don’t pay one cent for this.
Watered down version of an already watery beer. rarely acceptable if another beer is available
a lighter version of corona.  em, how’s that possible?  anyway, they’ve done it.  cool bottle though.
Mexican beer is piss in a bottle, but what better way to enjoy piss.  Not bad, but not good either.
wrose than regular corona yet better than most american canned beers.  I wouldn’t pay 10 cents for 12

Phewww...what a smell...dead skunk on a highway at 80C!  On closer smell, just a bland light lager.  Pale yellow with no head. As much taste and has refreshing as mineral water, with a bit of corn syrup thrown in!

My Mom, bless her soul, brought me a 12-pack of this last fall when I moved. While it was very thoughtful of her to bring me beer, I  am a little different than the people she had just observed enjoying it at a retirement party. Maybe they loved it, or maybe they were just old, boring and uneducated about beer, but I sure had a hard time drinking it or giving it away. And to think, she gave my sister’s boyfriend some Great Lakes Christmas Ale for Christmas, because she knew he liked Guinness!!!  (Surely he hated it, though I would have loved it!)
Fairly flavorless.  I can’t believe I’d say go with Corona, but it is a better option in this case.  My recommendation: Pacifico.
Better than regular Corona because there is less of that Corona taste.  Better than water, better than light beer from a can.
Slightly better than Coors light.  Which every other light beer is.  Another normal light beer.  Terrible.
light yellow no real head very very mild smell mostly I smelled the lime... it was a light palate w/ a light carbonation and a flavor reminisent of water.  Overall not good but unoffensive.

This beer is pretty good, it has a light taste, I mean Corona Extra is pretty light as it is, its not really good without lime, it tastes very sweet er, i dont know how to describe it other than being very light and mellow

Pours straw yellow with a tiny amount of soda-like head. "Fizz" would be a better word. Aroma is dill and mint, faint malt/corn, and just a bit of skunk. Taste is very much like club soda, with just a hint of warm malt in the finish. Body is very thin. Pretty vapid stuff. Like Corona Extra, but less taste. Not much of anything but fizz. Two things in it’s defense: 1.If a pale lager is ever place-appropriate, Mexico is probably the place. (Not Golden CO or St. Louis MO.) 2. Though it doesn’t taste that good, it at least isn’t offensive. Like say, a certain pale lager that is brewed in St. Louis. Overpriced, over advertised, and certainly not the best of Mexican beer. But once or twice a year, it sounds good to me. Go figure.

Corona is better (in fact, good) combined with fruit (lime)…and in the hot sun, and eating a fish taco...In Mexico...(give it high marks for that... and the fact that this was the beer that got my wife to start trying beers in the first place!)  That being said, let me rate it like I would any other beer (without lime).  Pours a stereotypical yellow and ultra clear.  The flavor is best described as carbonated and cool neutrality at first.  This moves into syrupy stale malt that lingers oh so briefly.  Fades to relative nothing.  The body is negligible.  Mine you…I would not dare let this warm up.  So, the rate you are reading is from a Cold sample.
Found in fridge after party. Very cold and fizzy. Maybe it would be better warm?  Drinking it cold simply hides whatever flavour it could possibly contain.  Good for cutting the lawn.

Recently had at Taco Cabana.  Bottle.  Yellow with heavy carbonation.  Nose is astringent and sharp, probably from the bubbles.  Tastes like thin corn, the bubbles rush it up your nose.  OK with corn chips but certainly a last resort.  Must be served very cold to be drinkable.
Yeah, it’s corona, the beer you put lime in to keep the bugs away. Bugs also like the smell of urine. I will say I enjoy a corona every once in a while, on a hot day.
It’s like Corona Extra...but worse! Hey if you like tastless beer that looks as if it came out of a urinal, and your looking to cut calories, this is your beer!  Why did I drink this?

Better than alot of mass produced beers. Just a light version of Corona Extra that doesn’t taste much different from the origional. I guess thats a good thing but the original is nothing special either. Good with mexican food if there’s nothing else.

I haven’t been doing this rating game long, but I’ve made it a rule to rate the beer as I drink it.  This one was offered to me by my 21-year old daughter.  It is not good.  As the others claim, it does have a skunky smell to it.  It’s very carbonated; after pouring, the fizz made it sound like a soda.  The head disappeared quick and the taste was never there.  This stuff sells like crazy  - go figure!
The Red headed skunky step child in the Corona family.  The Corona is already light enough, no?  I guess it looked good for a pale lager.

In the clear bottle. Had one of these at Maj. Choi’s housewarming party (You didn’t think that I would pay for such a beer, DID YOU?). It is indeed brewed, so one could expect the contents to be relatively sterile. That means you could use this substance to irrigate a dermal wound perhaps. I think that you could effectively rinse your hands with the contents, as the flu vaccine may not be available in your area this year. Maybe you could use the ice-cold bottle as a cold-pack to relieve swelling from a contusion. WARNING: NOT FOR INTERNAL USE.
See Corona review.  Everything’s the same except that it is more watered down and has even less taste of beer.  I felt this only made the skunkiness stand out even more.
