Bottle: Poured what must be the lightest yellow corn lager in the world without any head and a strong skunky aroma. Wow, truly one of the worst beer I had the misfortune of drinking. No much more that I can say about this…

It’s like Corona, but slightly worse.

That’s about it. Without lime, I can’t drink it. With lime, I find it goes okay with Mexican food, or sometimes pizza.

Pale yellow with light head. Skunk on the nose that wafts into the air uninvited.  Bland, though the water like qualities are only overshadowed by rotten cornlike flavors. Fortunatly the finish is quick.

Coronas work best in an outdoor party setting, and incredible when ice cold.  This beer has become extremely popular recently, but the notoriety lives up to its taste.  A little expensive for college kids, we like to drink this most at parties hosted by our friends or parents.  The light variety of this beer flows like water and lots can be consumed very easily.

another light beer.   these are good for keeping you from getting full, but good for little else.   this one was not very hoppy.  alirght so what if i’m trying to get to #100, and filling in with the lesser beers, or in this case water.   but i’m excited!  can you blame me?  anyway i’ll leave this particular brew for my wife.
I was very upset when a visitor brought only a 6-pack of the Corona Light for the both of us to share. I like this a lot. A lot.
This would be the tinniest flavored of the Mexican lagers if they hadn’t watered it down like Extra.  I don’t know why anyone drinks this stuff.
impressive for a light beer, when watching calories this is a decent choice, it beats out the other usual suspects in light beer

As far as low end beers go, this one is all right. The taste is pleasant and refreshing when you’ve been hot or just eating hot Mexican food. If I were gonna get me some Corona, I’d probably get a Corona Light.
Not a bad beer.  I actually like it better than regular ol’ Corona.  It has a stronger taste.  Imagine Corona on steroids.  As such, it jsut doesn’t need that gratuitous lime.  Not too bad.
Watered down corona.  See my review of for that beer to understand my feelings on this beer.

Light Corona? That’s like making Light Rolling Rock, its already light to begin with.  Phenomenally not good.  3.7% abv? My sweat is higher than that (and I don’t judge any beer based on its alcohol content, I call shens on this one)

I picked up a single for shits and giggles. Well it will probably end up being more for shits if you know what I mean. A nice wack of corn and water. I cant believe people pay $8 a sixer for this swill. The biggest rip off in the history of beer. No more please!

More of the same on the light Corona taste, even before they took out the alcohol, except this is even more watery.   Doesn’t fare too badly when drank with good tasty Mexican food, a nice wash that doesn’t impunge the flavors of the meal too much.  Otherwise, a decent beer for a light beer, doesn’t block up the palate too repulsively.

Only aroma you get is a slight skunky malt.  Piss yellow color with minimal head.  A very slight skunky corn malt flavor as well and that will disappear with a lime wedge.   No redeeming qualities at all - overpriced, poor quality.  You’re better off buying one of the many Central American knock-offs - you’ll save money and you can’t help but get a better beer.
As bad as Corona is by it self, a light version is even worse. Don’t waste a lime or salt, save it for the Tequila.
Another watered down light beer.  Probably would be better off selling as bottled water.  Please don’t put a lime in your beer.
piss water in a bottle, w/more added water to it, and have to have a lime w/it, w/out that its even worse, HORRID beer overall. w/&w/out lilme....yuck!
Big skunky smell.  Only time I needed a lime/lemon to make a beer tolerable.  100 degrees and humid would make this one look good.

Corona Light has approximately 30% less taste than Corona Extra.  When you take away 30% from no taste, what are you left with?  That’s right, a fizzy yellow, extremely gassy concoction that wreaks havoc on tastebuds.

[12 oz. bottle] Pale gold color with not much carbonation. Extremely bitter flavor and aroma. Tastes just like Corona Extra, which still begs the question, why does a beer need a lime in the neck of the bottle to make it taste better?
Its Corona Light. Take Corona add water and a lime of course and you have yourself a Corona Light...Forget about carbs your drinking beer.
Corona with less calories, where do I sign up? Must have with a lime. Better than Sol.
What can I say??  It quenches a dry palate and tastes like water with a touch of beer in it.  I’ve had worse.

Frankly, candidly, only had this once during cinco de mayo this year.  Just had to tried it to see if I could tell the difference between this and my friend’s Extra beer.  Maan.. DEFINATELY a light beer!!  Very bland!!  The beer was just utterly horrible.  It lacked everything from character to taste. No malt no hop flavor either.   ADVICE add lime or lemon to ease your suffering!!  God Bless those who can drink this stuff!! Haha

I didn’t actually drink a whole bottle of this. Not even much of a part of a bottle. I took a sip from my daughter’s bottle. Was curious to see if I could tell the difference between this and the Extra. I could. There’s even less here than in the Extra. A truly light beer. So light, it’s almost not even there. There’s no there there.
This is a bad beer, that is very trendy, it is absolute crap! I get soooo many people asking for this at my bar, I’m glad we don’t have it!

Bottled.  Blande, drinkable...lime usually helps with drinkablility, but sometimes I just can’t take it.  Better than a lot of standards.  Gold, fizzy, minimal flavor; no malt//hop character...go figure.
Tastes like soap. Adding a lime does nothing but make it foam and taste like citrus soap.
THis beer was decent for a light variety, but stll lacked charachter and a decent taste.
As if the original wasn’t bad enough they have to outdo themselves...I’m sure this is for the small minority of people that like bland beer...and I hope their happy.

How do you make corona extra worse?? Make a light version of it.  You can always tell who is a weiner.  They are the one with the corona with a lime in the neck.  Not much different than exta only blander.

I actually enjoy a corona light on a hot day, at a barbeque, or out on the deck with some chips and guac. Sure, its pale, watery, almost flavorless.. but served ice cold, it goes down unoffensively, and the fizz quenches your thirst while cutting through the fatty foods.

When I thought Corona could not be more offensive, I tried a corona light.  I beg corona to put a lemon or lime in the bottle for us, maybe it will impart some flavor.  
Talk about people paying for advertising!  Awful.

We took our friend Dennis out to a local Mexican place for his birthday lunch, so I took the opportunity to do a side-by-side comparison of this and the regular Corona "Extra".  Although this was thinner and had less body, this beer won the contest hands down because it’s simply refreshing and he fizzy body helps to leave the palate cleansed.  Unoffensive.

Expensive bottle of water, I can go anywhere and get a glass of water with a lemon or a lime for free. I did not need to spend 13 dollars for 12 of these pretty bottles. I know why everyone puts limes in them it gives them flavor and an aroma. Want fruit get what old ladies order at theme restaurants. I will never get their “save water drink corona beer” cause it has more water then water, I guess it keeps you hydrated on the beeches. Sick excuse of a beer.

Well, the same watered down lager taste as Corona, only with a bit more water. Less body, obviously. Not much to recommend it. If you want a watery beer with little or no taste, at least shoot for a cheap domestic. There’s little difference.

Bottle at Sidewalk Cafe, Venice Beach, Los Angeles. Mmmm another light beer for lunch! Reasonable to start off with: fairly chunky taste - citric, fizzy. Then te flavour disintegrates and is no more. Ends up with a smooth, flat, burnt plastic aftertaste. Still one of the better ’lights’ I’ve had.
Bottle: Same refreshing taste as Corona.  So not much/any aroma besides skunk and the taste sure doesn’t get any better.  I can drink this on a summer day- but not for taste.

Like Corona - only worse. Can you IMAGINE? Okay, it’s not worse. it’s just less of what you don’t want and more water, so it’s good for you. Yeh, that’s the ticket. Drink more. You’ll be doing SOMEONE a favor, but certainly not yourself.
This as almost impossible. Corona is very light in style to start with. This takes it a step further. And it’s not a good step.

12 oz., drunk straight from the bottle with no lime.  Sampled side-by-side with a canned Miller Light.  Color is obviously light yellow/gold, and there’s not much of its fizzy, white head.  Slightly skunky up front with no real flavor after that.  Thin mouthfeel.  This is crap.
who put a fuc*ing skunk in my god*amn beer?.................................
I must admit I sampled this brew only because it is readily available. simply said I was glad I could give the balnce to someone else.
Well, for Cinco de Mayo this would probably beer good.  Not as skunky smelling and even lighter in body than regular Corona.  Try it really cold when its really hot out.
See Corona Extra... then take away flavor which the Extra already lacks. Toss a lime in it to make believe it has flavor, and you're good to go!
How is it fathomably possible to make corona even lighter than it already is?
Its like Corona, but even with  less flavour.  I can't see how people make fun of American beer and then go on to extol the virtues of Corona.
Very pale yellow in color.  Nothing going on for aroma or taste.  Not a good beer.
This stuff is absolutely horrible. I guess Mexican light beer is just as bad as American light beer.
I would rather drink piss in a bottle then this stuff.  They should keep this shit in Mexico

Very pale gold. Big white soapy head. Quickly dissiapation of the foam to a wimpy slick. Horribly skunked aroma. Soda water. Traces of hops and maybe they yelled "MALT!" at the bottle. Unappetizing. I imagine it finishes with me getting crippling diarrea in the morning.

Ridiculous.  This is probalby the lightest beer produced, if beer is even the right name.  I don't get it.  Was Corona too heavy for you? do you not want all the flavor of corona?  I missed the boat on this one.  Guess I'll give it a point because it is less of whatever corona tastes like.
Less flavor, more watery appearance, same inflated price. Isn't even worth pounding one. STAY AWAY!!!

What was the point of this? Was Corona too heavy? The only advantage to this beer(over Corona Extra) is that is easier to finish quickly when someone offers you a beer and you are trying to be cordial. Skunk piss light. Great.
I thought that Corona extra was lacking, but there was obviously more to lose and this light beer has lost it.
I'm glad they put this in a clear bottle so I can admire the straw color and  the skunked taste.  Mmmmmm.  Why would anyone want to drink Corona Extra over this?
clear to pale straw yellow color. fizzy white head and a ring of lacing. Low carbonation. This is like corona gone bad. Watery, flavorless, terrible malt profile with a repulsive tart finish.
Very much like Corona, its only really flavor comes from the lime it was served with.
I must be mistaken, I thought Corona Extra was light.  Well, this is even lighter and more offensive.  Water, please.

12 oz bottle.  Very light apple juice, tiny fizzy instantly fading head.  Simply dreadful skunky-piss aroma, made me screw up my face and question the wisdom of actually tasting it.  Flavor is nasty stale bitterness (doubt that it’s hops, probably shavings from a lead factory or something) in carbonated water.  There’s just nothing good here at all.  For those who love bitterness, I challenge you to experience this particular bitterness, I really do.  Or, no, I don’t hate anyone that much.
This beer has little to offer in terms of taste and quality. Must have lime just for taste.
Pale fizzy yellow beer with a white head. No aroma, no flavor and a thin watery palate.
Of course it is exaclty what you would expect. Very light in taste and mouthfeel. Nothing in the way of hops or grain flavor or aroma.

The taste and smell of Corona and Corona Light are very skunky at times (sure, add a lime and it's not a bad beer, but should I REALLY have to ADD something to a beer to make it drinkable??). There's virtually no taste to this besides the bit of skunkiness, but it does go down semi-smooth.

Pleased to see that not many people, relatively speaking, have expended the energy to rate this beer (I do it only to reach my first 10 and thereby activate my ratings).  It is watery, skunky (which is fantastic in another of my favorite intoxicants, but not in beer), and undeserved of its market share.  The two saving graces of this beer are it's assumed low-caloric content, and its possible use (in a pinch) as that "It's-a-sweltering-hot-Summer-and-I-just-finished-a-full-day-of-yardwork-and-I-need-a-cold-refreshing-beer" beer.
H.  TWO.  OH.  The lime redeems this and actually gives it a little bit of flavor - there's absolutely nothing there to speak of.  No aroma, no flavor, no mouthfeel, nothing.

Pale golden yellow body with piddly carbonation and a rapidly dissipating head. Aroma is of skunk and not much else. Watery palate and flavor. Faint citrus tang. Otherwise astonishly flavorless. I detect an underlayer of hops - no wait that's from the 3 Floyds Alpha King that formerly occupied this glass before this beer water came along. A palate cleanser and nothing more.
Two parts Corona Extra, one part water.  Put it the bottle and, PRESTO, Corona Light.  The only upside is the foul aroma and offensive flavors have been reduced by 30%, also.
Urine light? A good vehicle to drink lime juice. can someone tell me the point? Marketing plain and simple.
I would have to admit this is better than normal piss water Corona.  However, only jive ass turkeys around here drink Corona my roommate who swears by it.
by far one of my favorite beers, its better than its heavy "extra" brother
Corona is bad and likewise is corona light. This beer has the same bland mediocre taste as regular corona. Still one of the most overrated beers around

Well, its kind of funny that regular Corona is called "Extra", therefore this should be called Corona "did I just drink rain water?" They say brewed with the highest quality ingredients, yeah, nice water.

It's been awhile since I consumed garbage like this and Michelob Ultra on consecutive days.  Upon opening the bottle, a white-striped, black-furred animal with a long bushy tail jumped from the bottle, ran into the road, and was promptly killed by a speeding car.  That describes the aroma.  The flavor was likewise reminiscent of that peculiar, noxious mammal.  Why anybody would drink this as a staple is beyond me.

Post party 'fridge find. Y'know, we all know that putting a lime in a Corona is the mark of a dilletant (sp), but I think I may have been looking at this the wrong way. The fact is, a single lime wedge just isn't enough. What I have found is that it takes about half a lime to mask the awful smell and flavor, and has the bonus of giving it some color. So the next time you are at DUIFridays and your waitress, Misty, asks you if you'd like a lime wedge to go with your Corona Light, look her straight in the eye and say "No Ma'am! bring me half a lime, and a juicer!" You can thank me later.
pale pale pale, no head to be found.  smells like a wet skunk and doesn't taste much better.  corona is pretty light already, I just don't see the need for this.  absolutely awful.

Clear golden body with a thin, fizzy, white head that completely dissappears from the top of the beer. Skunky aroma at first, but then some mild, sweet hints of corn and malts arise. Light body with lots of carbonation. Crisp mouthfeel. The flavor up front is just a tad sweet. The finish is crisp and clean with ansolutely no flavors. Wow, tastes almost exactly like soda water except for the very light, initial sweetness. This is the beer for those who do not want to taste what they drink.

I want to analyze the commercial desription of Corona Light before I get to my rating:

>>Corona Light has approximately 30% less calories than Corona Extra<<
...I was naturally very excited when I found this out.  I mean, my regular regimen of Corona Extra sure has been putting the pounds on me.  

>> with the same refreshing taste (of Corona Extra)<<
...same refreshing taste???  Im guessing the marketing department down there incorrectly used a thesaurus--seriously guys, I don't think that "refreshing" is a synonym for "ball sweat".

>> and is also brewed with the highest quality ingredients.<<

...Im sure the first ingredient on the list for this beer is Mexico's highest quality tap water. 

Anyways, let me wait no longer and indulge in this beer, for my heart is pounding with anticipation!

Poured pee yellow, almost no head.  Oh, and good work with the clear bottles guys...this beer was dealt a bad hand from the start, have some mercy on it.  The aroma was very offensive, strong skunk smell with notes of B.O. and Mexico, surprise.  Now for the taste.  I had to hold my breath as my lips touched the glass and my nose got ever closer to this foul beast.  Taste was.....well.....NOT BAD!  and when i say "NOT BAD", I mean that it was about as appetizing as a bloody ejaculation.  

Here is a list of things I would rather have than another Corona Light:

Cave Creek Chili Beer (at least I got a rubber chili pepper to play with once I poured it down the sink),
The Big 'n Tastey from McDonalds,
SARS.                                      

Im done

Very light yellow color and no head to speak of.  Flavor is weak, but not much weaker than Corona Extra.  Not as consistant an Extra either, as it has the occasional coppery hint to it (as if it were a can, but its not a can, see?!)  Another 'Monty Python' beer.

Pale yellow.  No head.  Hardly any visible carbonation.  Aroma of light malt, light DMS, slight woody notes.  Spritzy, watery, slightly grainy.  That’s not bitterness, is it?  Damn.  Of course, that’s when you’re analyzing the beer.  If you swig it, it’s awful.  So if you’re forced to drink this (because you’re in a tropical climate where the water is unsafe, but you have to drive), analyze it.  It’s the only way this thing is drinkable.
better than the original still not a great beer,  at least I can choke down this stuff.

The thought of having a Corona that is lighter than the original is almost absurd. But the Corona Light really has more flavor than Corona Extra. Although the lime is still needed this beer does have a slightly bitter taste, although metallic, without the lime.
Gold in colour.  No aroma aside from this slight skunkiness.  No flavour either, wasn't expecting any anyway.  Not sure that a lighter corona is even necessary.  Overall, just like water.
yellow and tasteless.  Not enjoyable like he original.  There just isn't anything good to say about this light beer.
If you thought Corona Extra was bad, this is worse, as most light versions of beers usually are, very skunky flavors & aroma, the lime didn't even help, the Extra is much better

This brew poured a medium head ofwhite bubbles that left a good lacing and a transparent golden wheat colored body behind.  Its aroma is mildly hoppy.  The flavor comes on initially strong with hops then finishes more mildly.

(bottled).  Faint grainy aroma.  Pale straw and brilliantly clear.  Very thin bodied with nice corn flavor, virtually no bitterness except for the very high carbonation bite.  Suprisingly, quite palatable, especially if you're dehydrated after, say, mowing the lawn.  After all, we are rating the beer for it's qualities and how it fits its style, not its marketing, right?

i truly don't understand all the low ratings on corona light.i find this one of the better lighter beers i ever had. i find it has a nice taste for a lighter beer for lighter beer usually has no taste at all.i would'nt say it's the best brew i ever had but it's a lot better than people say it is.
I actually didn't taste any significant deviation in flavor from the typical Corona.  Clear bottles, what are they thinking?

WHY? WHY? DEAR GOD WHY?
If you desperate for a smaller ass, thats the only reason to drink this crap.

Very noticeable dry yeast/lager aroma. Light gold in body with lots of visible carbonation and a white head, which is small and somewhat lasting. Very light flavor but with some bite. Just had Michelob Golden Draft Light and this one has less flavor. Very drinkable but a little bland.
Skunk Beer. All I have to say. Modelo is much much better. Tecate too if a Mexican beer is what you want.

this was downright skunky..though it came from completely enclosed 12 pack..you know..mexican beer..you put a lime in it and it tastes like lime..so whatever, i like limes..This is noticeable lighter than corona though, and i didnt know such things were possible..30% less calories huh..wippidty doo bazzle..what does it all mean???
Better than Corona Extra because it tastes more like water and less like Corona. Pale yellow. Grainy aroma with a touch of skunk. Carbonation feels artificial but it is not overly vigorous.

Clear, light straw-colored lager. Small white head.
Typical Mexican pils. Less skunk than Corona Extra.
The flavor is of seltzer water. Goes well with cold cuts and chips... near a large body of water.
Well-balanced, but so is club soda. Crisp, clean finish.
Bottled at a Bennigans. Had a little of a skunked smell but that's it. Looked like and tasted just like any other light beer. Oh wait light beers don't have taste. So this one fits the bill nicely.
Sharp, pungent, faintly spicy aroma.... isn't that how you'd describe skunky? Thank God that's only the aroma and it doesn't taste like that as well. Then again, some flavor would be nice....
Remind me again why Corona needs a light beer. Just put some ice in your mouth.
What's the point? Wasn't extra light enough? Try new Corona Light, for when water's just too damn heavy..
I didn't think there was anything wrong with it. Not the best, but definitely not the worst. You can't expect too much from it. Just a good summer beer when you're hot and thirsty.
Not that bad. Pours a beautiful water colour with no head. Tastes slightly like beer.
For a light beer--- it's pretty good. The color is too yellow, but come on... tastes great!
How on earth can you make a "light" version of one the the planet Earth's most watery beers?  I suppose that it does make the regular Corona seem to be a little tastier in comparison.
Bottle. I was not impressed with this beer at all. It had an aftertaste to it. It was watery and fizzy. Not an enjoyable drink.
This is quite bad. Reeks of adjuncts, and has a musty/swampy smell and flavor. Lime makes it a little better, but not by much. Even the regular version is more tolerable.
Everyone just about talks up this beer.  In any bar or club you'll see someone with a Corona with a lime.  Average brew, not worth all the myth and talk, but still a decent brew.  Pretty good.
The regular Corona is much better.  This beer has a very skunky odor to it.
I always thought the Extra was light enough.  Leave it to the American market to create a need for light light beer for people that are already overweight.  At any rate, not worth the money.
Thank goodness they serve this with a lemon or lime, if you had do drink it straight you would swear is was skunky water
don't drink the light, the real corona is much better drink and much more drinkable
Bottled. Corona Light? I didn't think it was even possible... Slightly metallic water with a extremely light hint of corn and a whole lot of fizz.

The same Atkins diet drinking buddy tried this tonight, as did I.  See my rating for regular Corona, add a ludicrous amount of water, and end up with this.  Skunky, pale and watery, but slightly better than Michelob Ultra.
Flavor? What's that? This beer has none. Even less than its original. If that's possible.
2 minutes in the sun spanks this water/beer in the lake.  I dont know why people drink this.  You people drink the water in mexico and drink this?  And the lime thing. UGHHH
Golden liquid with a small head.  Okay very light malt flavor if you can find a non-skunked bottle.  A tad watery for my taste.

Basically the same as it's non light brother. This seems to be more watery than regular Corona. Pours amber with a decent head. The scent is of slight citrus and malt blended with some hops. Good when its very cold and sickening otherwise. Beware.

A fizzy very light fizzy beer. No head. Aroma is slightly skunky malts. Very light flavor, there is a very very slight maltyness. No noticeable hops. But even thought it has little or no flavor, at least what is there is not offensive. Sort of like water with some malts and alcohol. About all one can say. Mouthfeel is thin. Finish is neutral. Aftertaste is very slightly bitter. Also pissed that this stuff cost  some larrge frelling $$.
For those who want to look impressive with a lime-garnished drink without the calories.. or take Corona Extra and water it down.
I didn't really like this stuff. I thought it tasted almost skunkier than corona extra with more water of course. There are better light beers out there.
Corona Extra is bad enough...this was just a waste of time.  No qualms about it...a poorly done beer.
dammit..go for the gold..Corona doesnt have that many calories to begin with, so why lose more with a light version of it?

Bottle. Head is initially small, fizzy, white, fully diminishing. Body is clear light to medium yellow. Aroma is lightly malty (cereal, grain, husks), with notes of DMS and soap. Flavor is lightly to moderately sweet, lightly bitter. Finish is lightly sweet, lightly to moderately bitter, unclean. Light body, watery texture, fizzy carbonation. Truly bad.
Why would you take a bad beer, and make it worse?  Please let me know if anyone ever finds out.
